SOC Definition: Determine and formulate policies and provide overall direction of companies or private and public sector organizations within guidelines set up by a board of directors or similar governing body. Plan, direct, or coordinate operational activities at the highest level of management with the help of subordinate executives and staff managers.

SOC Definition: Plan, direct, or coordinate the operations of public or private sector organizations, overseeing multiple departments or locations. Duties and responsibilities include formulating policies, managing daily operations, and planning the use of materials and human resources, but are too diverse and general in nature to be classified in any one functional area of management or administration, such as personnel, purchasing, or administrative services. Usually manage through subordinate supervisors. Excludes First-Line Supervisors.

SOC Definition: Develop, introduce, or enact laws and statutes at the local, tribal, state, or federal level. Includes only workers in elected positions.

SOC Definition: Plan, direct, or coordinate marketing policies and programs, such as determining the demand for products and services offered by a firm and its competitors, and identify potential customers. Oversee product development or monitor trends that indicate the need for new products and services.

SOC Definition: Plan, direct, or coordinate the actual distribution or movement of a product or service to the customer. SOC Definition: Plan, direct, or coordinate activities in such fields as electronic data processing, information systems, systems analysis, and computer programming. Excludes “Computer Occupations” (15-1211 through 15-1299).

SOC Title: Farmers, Ranchers, and Other Agricultural Managers
title_lower: farmers, ranchers, and other agricultural managers
SOC Definition: Plan, direct, or coordinate the management or operation of farms, ranches, greenhouses, aquacultural operations, nurseries, timber tracts, or other agricultural establishments. May hire, train, and supervise farm workers or contract for services to carry out the day-to-day activities of the managed operation. May engage in or supervise planting, cultivating, harvesting, and financial and marketing activities. Excludes “First-Line Supervisors of Farming, Fishing, and Forestry Workers” (45-1011).

Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: The COVID-19 pandemic has been particularly difficult for farmers, ranchers, and other agricultural managers. The closures of huge food processing plants due to outbreaks and loss of business from shuttered restaurants and commercial kitchens caused the industry to take a dip, but experts say it's poised to bounce back. Over the past few decades, job growth for farmers has held steady as increased agricultural efficiency has consolidated the country's food production into a smaller number of large farms.
Stacker Description: Agricultural managers oversee the complex operations of farms, ranches, and other food production facilities. They coordinate planting and harvesting schedules, manage livestock care, supervise workers, and handle financial planning and marketing. These professionals must balance traditional farming knowledge with modern technology and business acumen.

SOC Definition: Plan, direct, or coordinate, usually through subordinate supervisory personnel, activities concerned with the construction and maintenance of structures, facilities, and systems. SOC Definition: Plan, direct, or coordinate activities of an organization or department that serves food and beverages. Excludes “Chefs and Head Cooks” (35-1011).

SOC Definition: Plan, direct, or coordinate gambling operations in a casino. May formulate house rules.
From Occupation Data: Plan, direct, or coordinate gambling operations in a casino. May formulate house rules.

Stacker Description: Gambling managers supervise casino floor operations, overseeing table games, slot machines, and gaming staff. SOC Definition: Plan, direct, or coordinate the activities of a social service program or community outreach organization. SOC Definition: Plan and direct disaster response or crisis management activities, provide disaster preparedness training, and prepare emergency plans and procedures for natural (e.g., hurricanes, floods, earthquakes), wartime, or technological (e.g., nuclear power plant emergencies or hazardous materials spills) disasters or hostage situations.

Stacker Description: Urban and regional planners shape the future of communities by developing comprehensive strategies for land use and infrastructure development. They work with local governments to design sustainable growth plans for cities, towns, and metropolitan areas. These professionals balance economic development with environmental concerns, transportation needs, and quality of life considerations to create functional, livable spaces for residents and businesses.

SOC Definition: Study the origin, development, and behavior of human beings. May study the way of life, language, or physical characteristics of people in various parts of the world. May engage in systematic recovery and examination of material evidence, such as tools or pottery remaining from past human cultures, in order to determine the history, customs, and living habits of earlier civilizations.
From Occupation Data: Study the origin, development, and behavior of human beings. May study the way of life, language, or physical characteristics of people in various parts of the world. May engage in systematic recovery and examination of material evidence, such as tools or pottery remaining from past human cultures, in order to determine the history, customs, and living habits of earlier civilizations.
Stacker Description: Anthropologists and archaeologists study human culture and history through different lenses—anthropologists focus on living societies while archaeologists examine past civilizations through material remains. They analyze everything from language and customs to ancient tools and pottery fragments. Their research helps us understand human evolution, cultural development, and how societies have adapted to different environments throughout history.

SOC Definition: Study the nature and use of areas of the Earth’s surface, relating and interpreting interactions of physical and cultural phenomena. Conduct research on physical aspects of a region, including land forms, climates, soils, plants, and animals, and conduct research on the spatial implications of human activities within a given area, including social characteristics, economic activities, and political organization, as well as researching interdependence between regions at scales ranging from local to global.
From Occupation Data: Study the nature and use of areas of the Earth's surface, relating and interpreting interactions of physical and cultural phenomena. Conduct research on physical aspects of a region, including land forms, climates, soils, plants, and animals, and conduct research on the spatial implications of human activities within a given area, including social characteristics, economic activities, and political organization, as well as researching interdependence between regions at scales ranging from local to global.
Stacker Description: Geographers study how physical and human elements interact across Earth's surface, from local neighborhoods to global regions. They analyze everything from climate patterns and landforms to economic activities and cultural characteristics. These researchers examine how natural disasters affect communities, track migration patterns, or assess environmental changes. Most geographers work in government agencies, consulting firms, or educational institutions.

SOC Definition: Research, analyze, record, and interpret the past as recorded in sources, such as government and institutional records, newspapers and other periodicals, photographs, interviews, films, electronic media, and unpublished manuscripts, such as personal diaries and letters.
From Occupation Data: Research, analyze, record, and interpret the past as recorded in sources, such as government and institutional records, newspapers and other periodicals, photographs, interviews, films, electronic media, and unpublished manuscripts, such as personal diaries and letters.
Stacker Description: Historians research and interpret past events by examining diverse sources like government records, personal letters, photographs, and digital media. They piece together narratives that help us understand how societies, cultures, and institutions evolved over time. While some focus on specific periods or regions, others specialize in particular themes like military history or social movements.

SOC Definition: Study the origin, development, and operation of political systems. May study topics, such as public opinion, political decisionmaking, and ideology. May analyze the structure and operation of governments, as well as various political entities. May conduct public opinion surveys, analyze election results, or analyze public documents. Excludes “Survey Researchers” (19-3022).
From Occupation Data: Study the origin, development, and operation of political systems. May study topics, such as public opinion, political decisionmaking, and ideology. They study everything from voting patterns and public opinion to international relations and policy outcomes. These researchers conduct surveys, examine election data, and analyze political institutions to understand power dynamics. Their work helps explain political behavior and informs public policy discussions.

SOC Title: Social Scientists and Related Workers, All Other
title_lower: social scientists and related workers, all other
SOC Definition: All social scientists and related workers not listed separately.
From Occupation Data: All social scientists and related workers not listed separately.
Stacker Description: Social scientists in specialized fields examine human behavior and societal patterns through various lenses. This diverse group includes criminologists who study crime patterns, demographers who analyze population trends, and survey researchers who design studies. They use statistical analysis and research methods to understand social phenomena and often work for government agencies, nonprofits, or private research firms.

SOC Definition: Work with agricultural scientists in plant, fiber, and animal research, or assist with animal breeding and nutrition. Set up or maintain laboratory equipment and collect samples from crops or animals. Prepare specimens or record data to assist scientists in biology or related life science experiments. Conduct tests and experiments to improve yield and quality of crops or to increase the resistance of plants and animals to disease or insects.
From Occupation Data: Work with agricultural scientists in plant, fiber, and animal research, or assist with animal breeding and nutrition. They maintain laboratory equipment, collect plant and animal samples, and conduct experiments to improve crop yields or disease resistance. These technicians play a crucial role in advancing agricultural science, working in research facilities, farms, or government agencies to enhance food production.

SOC Definition: Work with food scientists or technologists to perform standardized qualitative and quantitative tests to determine physical or chemical properties of food or beverage products. Includes technicians who assist in research and development of production technology, quality control, packaging, processing, and use of foods.
From Occupation Data: Work with food scientists or technologists to perform standardized qualitative and quantitative tests to determine physical or chemical properties of food or beverage products. They conduct standardized tests to analyze physical and chemical properties, assist in developing new production technologies, and help maintain quality control standards. Their work spans from research labs to packaging facilities, playing a vital role in bringing safe, innovative food products to market.

SOC Definition: Assist biological and medical scientists. Set up, operate, and maintain laboratory instruments and equipment, monitor experiments, collect data and samples, make observations, and calculate and record results. May analyze organic substances, such as blood, food, and drugs.
From Occupation Data: Assist biological and medical scientists. Set up, operate, and maintain laboratory instruments and equipment, monitor experiments, collect data and samples, make observations, and calculate and record results. May analyze organic substances, such as blood, food, and drugs.

They operate sophisticated equipment, monitor ongoing experiments, and meticulously collect data and samples for analysis. From testing blood samples to analyzing drugs, these technicians ensure research runs smoothly while maintaining precise records that contribute to scientific breakthroughs and medical advances.

SOC Definition: Conduct chemical and physical laboratory tests to assist scientists in making qualitative and quantitative analyses of solids, liquids, and gaseous materials for research and development of new products or processes, quality control, maintenance of environmental standards, and other work involving experimental, theoretical, or practical application of chemistry and related sciences.
From Occupation Data: Conduct chemical and physical laboratory tests to assist scientists in making qualitative and quantitative analyses of solids, liquids, and gaseous materials for research and development of new products or processes, quality control, maintenance of environmental standards, and other work involving experimental, theoretical, or practical application of chemistry and related sciences.

Working with solids, liquids, and gases, they perform qualitative and quantitative analyses to support new product development, ensure quality control, and maintain environmental safety standards. Their precise work enables scientists to advance everything from pharmaceutical drugs to industrial materials through rigorous testing and experimentation.

SOC Title: Environmental Science and Protection Technicians, Including Health
title_lower: environmental science and protection technicians, including health
SOC Definition: Perform laboratory and field tests to monitor the environment and investigate sources of pollution, including those that affect health, under the direction of an environmental scientist, engineer, or other specialist. May collect samples of gases, soil, water, and other materials for testing.
From Occupation Data: Perform laboratory and field tests to monitor the environment and investigate sources of pollution, including those that affect health, under the direction of an environmental scientist, engineer, or other specialist. Working under environmental scientists and engineers, these technicians provide crucial data that helps safeguard communities and ecosystems.

SOC Definition: Assist scientists or engineers in the use of electronic, sonic, or nuclear measuring instruments in laboratory, exploration, and production activities to obtain data indicating resources such as metallic ore, minerals, gas, coal, or petroleum. Analyze mud and drill cuttings. Chart pressure, temperature, and other characteristics of wells or bore holes.

SOC Definition: Collect and organize data concerning the distribution and circulation of ground and surface water, and data on its physical, chemical, and biological properties. Measure and report on flow rates and ground water levels, maintain field equipment, collect water samples, install and collect sampling equipment, and process samples for shipment to testing laboratories. May collect data on behalf of hydrologists, engineers, developers, government agencies, or agriculture. Excludes “Hydrologists” (19-2043).
From Occupation Data: Collect and organize data concerning the distribution and circulation of ground and surface water, and data on its physical, chemical, and biological properties. They maintain monitoring equipment, collect samples for laboratory analysis, and measure how water moves through different environments. Their fieldwork supports hydrologists, engineers, and government agencies in making informed decisions about water conservation, flood control, and environmental protection efforts.

SOC Definition: Assist nuclear physicists, nuclear engineers, or other scientists in laboratory, power generation, or electricity production activities. May operate, maintain, or provide quality control for nuclear testing and research equipment. May monitor radiation.
From Occupation Data: Assist nuclear physicists, nuclear engineers, or other scientists in laboratory, power generation, or electricity production activities. May operate, maintain, or provide quality control for nuclear testing and research equipment. May monitor radiation.

SOC Definition: Assist social scientists in laboratory, survey, and other social science research. May help prepare findings for publication and assist in laboratory analysis, quality control, or data management. Excludes “Teaching Assistants, Postsecondary” (25-9044).

SOC Definition: Provide technical assistance regarding the conservation of soil, water, forests, or related natural resources. May compile data pertaining to size, content, condition, and other characteristics of forest tracts under the direction of foresters, or train and lead forest workers in forest propagation and fire prevention and suppression. May assist conservation scientists in managing, improving, and protecting rangelands and wildlife habitats. Excludes “Conservation Scientists” (19-1031) and “Foresters” (19-1032).
From Occupation Data: Provide technical assistance regarding the conservation of soil, water, forests, or related natural resources. These technicians compile essential data about forest characteristics and environmental conditions that guide conservation efforts and sustainable resource management practices.

SOC Definition: Collect, identify, classify, and analyze physical evidence related to criminal investigations. Perform tests on weapons or substances, such as fiber, hair, and tissue to determine significance to investigation. May testify as expert witnesses on evidence or crime laboratory techniques. May serve as specialists in area of expertise, such as ballistics, fingerprinting, handwriting, or biochemistry.

SOC Definition: Review, evaluate, and analyze work environments and design programs and procedures to control, eliminate, and prevent disease or injury caused by chemical, physical, and biological agents or ergonomic factors. May conduct inspections and enforce adherence to laws and regulations governing the health and safety of individuals. May be employed in the public or private sector.

SOC Definition: Collect data on work environments for analysis by occupational health and safety specialists. Implement and conduct evaluation of programs designed to limit chemical, physical, biological, and ergonomic risks to workers.
From Occupation Data: Collect data on work environments for analysis by occupational health and safety specialists. Implement and conduct evaluation of programs designed to limit chemical, physical, biological, and ergonomic risks to workers.

SOC Title: Substance Abuse and Behavioral Disorder Counselors
title_lower: substance abuse and behavioral disorder counselors
SOC Definition: Counsel and advise individuals with alcohol, tobacco, drug, or other problems, such as gambling and eating disorders. May counsel individuals, families, or groups or engage in prevention programs. Excludes “Psychologists” (19-3032 through 19-3039), “Mental Health Counselors” (21-1014), and “Social Workers” (21-1021 through 21-1029) providing these services.
From Occupation Data: Counsel and advise individuals with alcohol, tobacco, drug, or other problems, such as gambling and eating disorders. May counsel individuals, families, or groups or engage in prevention programs.

These counselors develop treatment plans, facilitate group sessions, and provide ongoing support to help clients achieve recovery and maintain healthy lifestyles.

SOC Title: Educational, Guidance, and Career Counselors and Advisors

SOC Definition: Diagnose and treat mental and emotional disorders, whether cognitive, affective, or behavioral, within the context of marriage and family systems. Apply psychotherapeutic and family systems theories and techniques in the delivery of services to individuals, couples, and families for the purpose of treating such diagnosed nervous and mental disorders. SOC Definition: Counsel and advise individuals and groups to promote optimum mental and emotional health, with an emphasis on prevention. May help individuals deal with a broad range of mental health issues, such as those associated with addictions and substance abuse; family, parenting, and marital problems; stress management; self-esteem; or aging. SOC Definition: Counsel individuals to maximize the independence and employability of persons coping with personal, social, and vocational difficulties that result from birth defects, illness, disease, accidents, aging, or the stress of daily life. Coordinate activities for residents of care and treatment facilities. Assess client needs and design and implement rehabilitation programs that may include personal and vocational counseling, training, and job placement. Excludes “Occupational Therapists” (29-1122).

SOC Title: Child, Family, and School Social Workers
title_lower: child, family, and school social workers
SOC Definition: Provide social services and assistance to improve the social and psychological functioning of children and their families and to maximize the family well-being and the academic functioning of children. May assist parents, arrange adoptions, and find foster homes for abandoned or abused children. In schools, they address such problems as teenage pregnancy, misbehavior, and truancy. May also advise teachers.

SOC Definition: Provide individuals, families, and groups with the psychosocial support needed to cope with chronic, acute, or terminal illnesses. Services include advising family caregivers. Provide patients with information and counseling, and make referrals for other services. May also provide case and care management or interventions designed to promote health, prevent disease, and address barriers to access to healthcare.

SOC Title: Mental Health and Substance Abuse Social Workers
title_lower: mental health and substance abuse social workers
SOC Definition: Assess and treat individuals with mental, emotional, or substance abuse problems, including abuse of alcohol, tobacco, and/or other drugs. Activities may include individual and group therapy, crisis intervention, case management, client advocacy, prevention, and education.

SOC Definition: Provide and manage health education programs that help individuals, families, and their communities maximize and maintain healthy lifestyles. May serve as resource to assist individuals, other health professionals, or the community, and may administer fiscal resources for health education programs. SOC Title: Probation Officers and Correctional Treatment Specialists
title_lower: probation officers and correctional treatment specialists

SOC Definition: Promote health within a community by assisting individuals to adopt healthy behaviors. SOC Definition: Conduct religious worship and perform other spiritual functions associated with beliefs and practices of religious faith or denomination. Provide spiritual and moral guidance and assistance to members.

SOC Definition: Represent clients in criminal and civil litigation and other legal proceedings, draw up legal documents, or manage or advise clients on legal transactions. May specialize in a single area or may practice broadly in many areas of law.
From Occupation Data: Represent clients in criminal and civil litigation and other legal proceedings, draw up legal documents, or manage or advise clients on legal transactions. May specialize in a single area or may practice broadly in many areas of law.
50 highest-paying jobs in America: The role of a lawyer is to provide legal counsel and representation to individuals, companies, or government agencies during legal disputes or events concerning the law. While lawyers are often associated with their work in courtrooms, they also file wills, contracts, and deeds. All lawyers in the United States earn a law degree—usually from an American Bar Association-accredited school—and pass a state's bar exam to practice.
Stacker Description: Lawyers represent clients in legal matters ranging from criminal defense to corporate transactions. They draft contracts, argue cases in court, negotiate settlements, and provide legal counsel on complex issues. While some attorneys work as generalists, many specialize in specific areas like family law, intellectual property, or environmental regulation. Most states require passing the bar exam and maintaining continuing education credits.

SOC Definition: Assist judges in court or by conducting research or preparing legal documents. Excludes “Lawyers” (23-1011) and “Paralegals and Legal Assistants” (23-2011).
From Occupation Data: Assist judges in court or by conducting research or preparing legal documents.
Stacker Description: Judicial law clerks work directly with judges to research legal precedents, draft opinions, and analyze case materials. These positions often serve as stepping stones for recent law school graduates seeking courtroom experience. Clerks review briefs, fact-check legal arguments, and help judges prepare for hearings. The role provides invaluable insight into judicial decision-making and legal reasoning at the highest levels.

SOC Title: Administrative Law Judges, Adjudicators, and Hearing Officers
title_lower: administrative law judges, adjudicators, and hearing officers
SOC Definition: Conduct hearings to recommend or make decisions on claims concerning government programs or other government-related matters. Determine liability, sanctions, or penalties, or recommend the acceptance or rejection of claims or settlements. Excludes “Arbitrators, Mediators, and Conciliators” (23-1022).
From Occupation Data: Conduct hearings to recommend or make decisions on claims concerning government programs or other government-related matters. Determine liability, sanctions, or penalties, or recommend the acceptance or rejection of claims or settlements.
Stacker Description: Administrative law judges preside over hearings involving government agencies and programs, making decisions on disputes related to benefits, regulations, and compliance issues. Unlike traditional judges, they typically handle cases outside standard courtrooms, focusing on specialized areas like immigration, social security, or environmental law. These positions require extensive legal knowledge and the ability to interpret complex federal and state regulations.

SOC Definition: Facilitate negotiation and conflict resolution through dialogue. Resolve conflicts outside of the court system by mutual consent of parties involved.
From Occupation Data: Facilitate negotiation and conflict resolution through dialogue. Resolve conflicts outside of the court system by mutual consent of parties involved.
Stacker Description: Arbitrators, mediators, and conciliators help resolve disputes without costly court proceedings. They facilitate discussions between conflicting parties, working to find mutually acceptable solutions in areas like labor relations, business contracts, and family matters. These professionals must remain neutral while guiding negotiations and may issue binding decisions in arbitration cases. Many have backgrounds in law, business, or specialized industry knowledge.

SOC Definition: Arbitrate, advise, adjudicate, or administer justice in a court of law. May sentence defendant in criminal cases according to government statutes or sentencing guidelines. May determine liability of defendant in civil cases. May perform wedding ceremonies.
From Occupation Data: Arbitrate, advise, adjudicate, or administer justice in a court of law. May sentence defendant in criminal cases according to government statutes or sentencing guidelines. May determine liability of defendant in civil cases. May perform wedding ceremonies.
50 highest-paying jobs in America: These law enforcers arbitrate, advise, adjudicate, and administer justice in courts of law. In criminal cases, judges, magistrate judges, and magistrates can issue sentences. Meanwhile, in civil cases, they determine liability. All three types of judges can also perform wedding ceremonies. Most judges are graduates of law school, and many hold doctorate degrees.
Stacker Description: Judges preside over court proceedings, ensuring fair application of the law while making critical decisions that affect people's lives. They sentence defendants in criminal cases, determine liability in civil disputes, and oversee legal proceedings from traffic violations to major felonies. Most judges require a law degree and extensive legal experience before appointment or election to the bench.

SOC Definition: Assist lawyers by investigating facts, preparing legal documents, or researching legal precedent. Conduct research to support a legal proceeding, to formulate a defense, or to initiate legal action. Excludes “Legal Secretaries and Administrative Assistants” (43-6012).
From Occupation Data: Assist lawyers by investigating facts, preparing legal documents, or researching legal precedent. Conduct research to support a legal proceeding, to formulate a defense, or to initiate legal action.
Stacker Description: Paralegals serve as essential support staff in law firms, conducting research, preparing legal documents, and investigating facts for cases. They help lawyers build stronger arguments by gathering evidence, interviewing witnesses, and organizing case files. While they cannot provide legal advice or represent clients, paralegals often specialize in areas like corporate law, criminal defense, or personal injury litigation.

SOC Definition: Search real estate records, examine titles, or summarize pertinent legal or insurance documents or details for a variety of purposes. From Occupation Data: Search real estate records, examine titles, or summarize pertinent legal or insurance documents or details for a variety of purposes. Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: Whether they work in real estate or insurance, title examiners, abstractors, and searchers consult records to examine titles or summarize legal documents for their employers. Typically, these employees compile lists of mortgages, contracts, and other related insurance documents.
Stacker Description: Title examiners investigate property ownership histories to ensure clear legal transfer of real estate. They search through public records, examine deeds and mortgages, and identify any liens or legal issues that could complicate property sales. Their meticulous work protects buyers, lenders, and title insurance companies from costly legal disputes over property ownership rights.

SOC Definition: Instruct preschool-aged students, following curricula or lesson plans, in activities designed to promote social, physical, and intellectual growth. Excludes “Special Education Teachers” (25-2050), “Substitute Teachers, Short-Term” (25-3031), and “Childcare Workers” (39-9011).

SOC Title: Elementary School Teachers, Except Special Education
title_lower: elementary school teachers, except special education

title_lower: middle school teachers, except special and career/technical education

title_lower: secondary school teachers, except special and career/technical education

SOC Title: Adult Basic Education, Adult Secondary Education, and English as a Second Language Instructors
title_lower: adult basic education, adult secondary education, and english as a second language instructors

SOC Definition: Teach or instruct individuals or groups for the primary purpose of self-enrichment or recreation, rather than for an occupational objective, educational attainment, competition, or fitness. SOC Definition: Teach students on a short-term basis as a temporary replacement for a regular classroom teacher, typically using the regular teacher’s lesson plan. SOC Definition: Instruct individual students or small groups of students in academic subjects to support formal class instruction or to prepare students for standardized or admissions tests. Excludes “Postsecondary Teachers” (25-1000), “Elementary, Middle, Secondary, and Special Education Teachers” (25-2000), “Adult Basic Education, Adult Secondary Education, and English as a Second Language Instructors” (25-3011), and “Self-Enrichment Teachers” (25-3021).

SOC Definition: All teachers and instructors not listed separately.

SOC Definition: Appraise, edit, and direct safekeeping of permanent records and historically valuable documents. Participate in research activities based on archival materials.

Working in museums, libraries, government agencies, and corporations, archivists combine detective skills with deep knowledge of history, technology, and information management to safeguard cultural heritage.

SOC Definition: Administer collections, such as artwork, collectibles, historic items, or scientific specimens of museums or other institutions. May conduct instructional, research, or public service activities of institution.

Beyond collection management, curators often conduct educational programs, write scholarly publications, and collaborate with researchers to advance public understanding of their specialized fields.

SOC Definition: Restore, maintain, or prepare objects in museum collections for storage, research, or exhibit. May work with specimens such as fossils, skeletal parts, or botanicals; or artifacts, textiles, or art. May identify and record objects or install and arrange them in exhibits. Includes book or document conservators.

Their meticulous work requires both technical expertise and artistic sensibility as they carefully clean, repair, and document everything from ancient textiles to modern sculptures.

SOC Definition: Administer and maintain libraries or collections of information, for public or private access through reference or borrowing. Work in a variety of settings, such as educational institutions, museums, and corporations, and with various types of informational materials, such as books, periodicals, recordings, films, and databases. Tasks may include acquiring, cataloging, and circulating library materials, and user services such as locating and organizing information, providing instruction on how to access information, and setting up and operating a library’s media equipment.
From Occupation Data: Administer and maintain libraries or collections of information, for public or private access through reference or borrowing. Stacker Description: Librarians and media collections specialists serve as information navigators in our digital age, helping patrons access vast resources across multiple formats and platforms. They curate collections, organize databases, and provide research assistance while adapting to evolving technologies. These professionals work in diverse settings from public libraries to corporate research centers, ensuring information remains accessible and well-organized for users.

SOC Definition: Assist librarians by helping readers in the use of library catalogs, databases, and indexes to locate books and other materials; and by answering questions that require only brief consultation of standard reference. Compile records; sort and shelve books or other media; remove or repair damaged books or other media; register patrons; and check materials in and out of the circulation process. Replace materials in shelving area (stacks) or files. Includes bookmobile drivers who assist with providing services in mobile libraries.

SOC Definition: Instruct and advise individuals and families engaged in agriculture, agricultural-related processes, or home management activities. Demonstrate procedures and apply research findings to advance agricultural and home management activities. May develop educational outreach programs. May instruct on either agricultural issues such as agricultural processes and techniques, pest management, and food safety, or on home management issues such as budgeting, nutrition, and child development. SOC Definition: Develop instructional material, coordinate educational content, and incorporate current technology into instruction in order to provide guidelines to educators and instructors for developing curricula and conducting courses. SOC Definition: Formulate design concepts and presentation approaches for visual productions and media, such as print, broadcasting, video, and film. Direct workers engaged in artwork or layout design. Excludes “Set and Exhibit Designers” (27-1027).

SOC Definition: Design and develop manufactured products, such as cars, home appliances, and children’s toys. Combine artistic talent with research on product use, marketing, and materials to create the most functional and appealing product design.

Success requires dedication to continuous training, networking skills, and resilience in a highly competitive field with irregular employment patterns.

SOC Definition: Produce or direct stage, television, radio, video, or film productions for entertainment, information, or instruction. Responsible for creative decisions, such as interpretation of script, choice of actors or guests, set design, sound, special effects, and choreography.

SOC Definition: Compete in athletic events.

While there typically isn't an educational requirement for this job, competitors usually have years of experience combined with athletic talent and knowledge of their sport. SOC Definition: Instruct or coach groups or individuals in the fundamentals of sports for the primary purpose of competition. Demonstrate techniques and methods of participation. SOC Title: Umpires, Referees, and Other Sports Officials
title_lower: umpires, referees, and other sports officials

SOC Definition: Play one or more musical instruments or sing. May perform on stage, for broadcasting, or for sound or video recording.

Radio disc jockeys are included in “Broadcast Announcers and Radio Disc Jockeys” (27-3011). Modern DJs use digital technology alongside traditional turntables, requiring technical skills in audio equipment and software plus an extensive knowledge of music across genres.

SOC Title: Entertainers and Performers, Sports and Related Workers, All Other

SOC Definition: Speak or read from scripted materials, such as news reports or commercial messages, on radio, television, or other communications media. SOC Definition: Narrate or write news stories, reviews, or commentary for print, broadcast, or other communications media such as newspapers, magazines, radio, or television. May collect and analyze information through interview, investigation, or observation.

These professionals must verify facts, meet tight deadlines, and present complex information in accessible ways while maintaining ethical standards and objectivity in an increasingly fast-paced media landscape.

SOC Definition: Promote or create an intended public image for individuals, groups, or organizations. May write or select material for release to various communications media. May specialize in using social media.
From Occupation Data: Promote or create an intended public image for individuals, groups, or organizations. May write or select material for release to various communications media. May specialize in using social media.

They write press releases, manage social media presence, organize events, and handle crisis communications to maintain positive public images. These professionals must understand both traditional and digital media landscapes, often serving as the bridge between their clients and journalists while monitoring public sentiment and adjusting messaging strategies accordingly.

SOC Definition: Plan, coordinate, revise, or edit written material. May review proposals and drafts for possible publication.

These professionals must master the art of making technical concepts accessible to diverse audiences while ensuring accuracy and compliance with industry standards and regulations.

SOC Definition: Originate and prepare written material, such as scripts, stories, advertisements, and other material. Excludes “News Analysts, Reporters, and Journalists” (27-3023), “Public Relations Specialists” (27-3031), and “Technical Writers” (27-3042).

SOC Definition: Interpret oral or sign language, or translate written text from one language into another.

Interpreters work in real-time during meetings, conferences, or legal proceedings, while translators focus on written documents like contracts, literature, or technical manuals. SOC Definition: Use verbatim methods and equipment to capture, store, retrieve, and transcribe pretrial and trial proceedings or other information. Some also provide real-time captioning for live broadcasts or events to assist hearing-impaired audiences, requiring exceptional multitasking abilities and technical proficiency.

SOC Definition: Set up, maintain, and dismantle audio and video equipment, such as microphones, sound speakers, connecting wires and cables, sound and mixing boards, video cameras, video monitors and servers, and related electronic equipment for live or recorded events, such as concerts, meetings, conventions, presentations, podcasts, news conferences, and sporting events. SOC Definition: Assemble and operate equipment to record, synchronize, mix, edit, or reproduce sound, including music, voices, or sound effects, for theater, video, film, television, podcasts, sporting events, and other productions. Excludes “Audio and Video Technicians” (27-4011).

SOC Definition: Set up, maintain, and dismantle light fixtures, lighting control devices, and the associated lighting electrical and rigging equipment used for photography, television, film, video, and live productions. May focus or operate light fixtures, or attach color filters or other lighting accessories. Excludes “Audio and Video Technicians” (27-4011).
From Occupation Data: Set up, maintain, and dismantle light fixtures, lighting control devices, and the associated lighting electrical and rigging equipment used for photography, television, film, video, and live productions. They install, maintain, and operate complex lighting systems, from basic fixtures to advanced control devices and rigging equipment. These professionals strategically focus lights, attach color filters, and manipulate lighting accessories to achieve the director's vision and enhance subjects' appearances.

SOC Definition: Photograph people, landscapes, merchandise, or other subjects. May use lighting equipment to enhance a subject’s appearance. May use editing software to produce finished images and prints. Includes commercial and industrial photographers, scientific photographers, and photojournalists. They utilize advanced lighting techniques and editing software to produce polished final images and prints. Whether working as photojournalists documenting current events or commercial photographers creating marketing materials, they combine artistic vision with technical expertise to tell stories through visual media.

SOC Title: Camera Operators, Television, Video, and Film

From Occupation Data: Edit moving images on film, video, or other media. May work with a producer or director to organize images for final production. May edit or synchronize soundtracks with images.

SOC Definition: Assess, treat, and care for patients by manipulation of spine and musculoskeletal system. May provide spinal adjustment or address sacral or pelvic misalignment.
From Occupation Data: Assess, treat, and care for patients by manipulation of spine and musculoskeletal system. May provide spinal adjustment or address sacral or pelvic misalignment.

They focus on alleviating back pain, neck pain, and headaches while promoting overall wellness without surgery or prescription medications. Most chiropractors complete a four-year doctoral program and must pass national board examinations to practice in their respective states.

SOC Definition: Examine, diagnose, and treat diseases, injuries, and malformations of teeth and gums. May treat diseases of nerve, pulp, and other dental tissues affecting oral hygiene and retention of teeth. May fit dental appliances or provide preventive care. Excludes “Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons” (29-1022), “Orthodontists” (29-1023), “Prosthodontists” (29-1024), and “Dentists, All Other Specialists” (29-1029).
From Occupation Data: Examine, diagnose, and treat diseases, injuries, and malformations of teeth and gums. May treat diseases of nerve, pulp, and other dental tissues affecting oral hygiene and retention of teeth. May fit dental appliances or provide preventive care.
50 highest-paying jobs in America: General dentists examine and treat the teeth and gums. This includes filling cavities, teaching patients about oral hygiene, and removing damaged or infected teeth. A dentist must earn a Doctor of Dental Surgery or Doctor of Medicine in Dentistry degree from a program certified by the Commission on Dental Accreditation.
Stacker Description: General dentists provide comprehensive oral healthcare, from routine cleanings and cavity fillings to diagnosing gum disease and performing extractions. They educate patients about preventive care, fit crowns and bridges, and serve as the first line of defense against serious dental problems. Most dentists complete four years of dental school after earning a bachelor's degree.

SOC Definition: Perform surgery and related procedures on the hard and soft tissues of the oral and maxillofacial regions to treat diseases, injuries, or defects. May diagnose problems of the oral and maxillofacial regions. May perform surgery to improve function or appearance.
From Occupation Data: Perform surgery and related procedures on the hard and soft tissues of the oral and maxillofacial regions to treat diseases, injuries, or defects. May diagnose problems of the oral and maxillofacial regions. May perform surgery to improve function or appearance.
50 highest-paying jobs in America: Oral and maxillofacial surgeons specialize in conditions involving the bones and tissues of the oral and maxillofacial region, which includes the neck, jaw, mouth, teeth, and face. They can improve the way these areas function or look after diseases, injuries, or other patient problems. It takes 12-14 years to become an oral or maxillofacial surgeon.
Stacker Description: Oral and maxillofacial surgeons perform complex procedures on the mouth, jaw, face, and neck regions. They handle everything from wisdom tooth extractions and jaw reconstructions to treating facial trauma and oral cancers. These specialists complete dental school plus four to six years of additional surgical training, making them among the most extensively educated healthcare professionals.

SOC Definition: Examine, diagnose, and treat dental malocclusions and oral cavity anomalies. Design and fabricate appliances to realign teeth and jaws to produce and maintain normal function and to improve appearance.
From Occupation Data: Examine, diagnose, and treat dental malocclusions and oral cavity anomalies. Design and fabricate appliances to realign teeth and jaws to produce and maintain normal function and to improve appearance.
50 highest-paying jobs in America: An orthodontist fixes misaligned teeth by installing braces and using other appliances. After completing dental school, aspiring orthodontists must pass the Integrated National Board Dental Examination and then obtain a license to specialize in orthodontics.
Stacker Description: Orthodontists specialize in correcting misaligned teeth and jaws through braces, retainers, and other appliances. Beyond improving smiles, they address functional problems that can affect chewing, speaking, and overall oral health. After dental school, orthodontists complete an additional two to three years of specialized residency training to master the complex mechanics of tooth movement and facial development.

SOC Definition: Diagnose, treat, rehabilitate, design, and fit prostheses that maintain oral function, health, and appearance for patients with clinical conditions associated with teeth, oral and maxillofacial tissues, or the jaw.
From Occupation Data: Diagnose, treat, rehabilitate, design, and fit prostheses that maintain oral function, health, and appearance for patients with clinical conditions associated with teeth, oral and maxillofacial tissues, or the jaw.
50 highest-paying jobs in America: Prosthodontists help restore or replace patients' missing teeth or jaw structures. Aside from designing and fitting prostheses, including implants and dentures, they diagnose and help treat clinical conditions. The American Dental Education Association says that this might be a promising career for people who enjoy puzzles, are inventive, and like constructing and deconstructing things—but you'll need to graduate from dental school and go through three years of residency.
Stacker Description: Prosthodontists are dental specialists who restore and replace damaged or missing teeth with crowns, bridges, dentures, and implants. They treat complex cases involving extensive tooth loss, jaw disorders, and facial trauma. This specialty requires three additional years of training beyond dental school, focusing on the intricate art and science of reconstructing oral function and aesthetics.

SOC Definition: All dentists not listed separately.
From Occupation Data: All dentists not listed separately.
Stacker Description: Dental specialists in this category include endodontists who perform root canals, periodontists who treat gum disease, and oral pathologists who diagnose mouth diseases. Each specialty requires additional years of training beyond dental school to master specific techniques and treatments. These experts handle complex cases that general dentists refer to them for specialized care.

SOC Definition: Plan and conduct food service or nutritional programs to assist in the promotion of health and control of disease. May supervise activities of a department providing quantity food services, counsel individuals, or conduct nutritional research.
From Occupation Data: Plan and conduct food service or nutritional programs to assist in the promotion of health and control of disease. May supervise activities of a department providing quantity food services, counsel individuals, or conduct nutritional research.

They work in hospitals, schools, sports teams, and private practice, creating dietary programs for medical conditions like diabetes or designing menus for large institutions. Most positions require a bachelor's degree in nutrition science and completion of an accredited internship program.

SOC Definition: Diagnose, manage, and treat conditions and diseases of the human eye and visual system. Examine eyes and visual system, diagnose problems or impairments, prescribe corrective lenses, and provide treatment. May prescribe therapeutic drugs to treat specific eye conditions. Ophthalmologists are included in “Ophthalmologists, Except Pediatric” (29-1241).
From Occupation Data: Diagnose, manage, and treat conditions and diseases of the human eye and visual system. Examine eyes and visual system, diagnose problems or impairments, prescribe corrective lenses, and provide treatment. May prescribe therapeutic drugs to treat specific eye conditions.

Stacker Description: Optometrists examine eyes, diagnose vision problems and eye diseases, and prescribe corrective lenses or medications. They detect conditions like glaucoma and macular degeneration, often serving as the first line of defense for eye health. Becoming an optometrist requires completing a four-year Doctor of Optometry program after earning a bachelor's degree, plus passing national and state licensing examinations.

SOC Definition: Dispense drugs prescribed by physicians and other health practitioners and provide information to patients about medications and their use. May advise physicians and other health practitioners on the selection, dosage, interactions, and side effects of medications.
From Occupation Data: Dispense drugs prescribed by physicians and other health practitioners and provide information to patients about medications and their use. May advise physicians and other health practitioners on the selection, dosage, interactions, and side effects of medications.

They work closely with physicians and other healthcare providers to ensure safe and effective treatment plans. Beyond filling prescriptions, pharmacists may also administer vaccines, conduct health screenings, and provide specialized services like compounding customized medications for individual patient needs.

SOC Definition: Provide healthcare services typically performed by a physician, under the supervision of a physician. Conduct complete physicals, provide treatment, and counsel patients. May, in some cases, prescribe medication. Must graduate from an accredited educational program for physician assistants. Excludes “Registered Nurses” (29-1141), “Nurse Anesthetists” (29-1151), “Nurse Midwives” (29-1161), “Nurse Practitioners” (29-1171), “Emergency Medical Technicians” (29-2042), “Paramedics” (29-2043), “Surgical Assistants” (29-9093), and “Medical Assistants” (31-9092).
From Occupation Data: Provide healthcare services typically performed by a physician, under the supervision of a physician. Conduct complete physicals, provide treatment, and counsel patients. May, in some cases, prescribe medication. Must graduate from an accredited educational program for physician assistants.
Stacker Description: Physician assistants provide comprehensive healthcare services under physician supervision, including conducting physical exams, diagnosing illnesses, and developing treatment plans. They can prescribe medications in most states and often serve as primary care providers in underserved areas. PAs must complete an accredited master's degree program and pass a national certification exam to practice.

SOC Definition: Diagnose and treat diseases and deformities of the human foot.

50 highest-paying jobs in America: These physicians specialize in foot, ankle, and lower leg problems, removing bone spurs, prescribing orthotics, and providing other treatments. To become a podiatrist, one must earn a Doctor of Podiatric Medicine and complete a three-year residency.
Stacker Description: Podiatrists specialize in diagnosing and treating conditions affecting the feet, ankles, and lower legs. They address everything from common issues like ingrown toenails and plantar fasciitis to complex deformities and diabetic foot complications. These specialists perform surgery, prescribe medications, and design custom orthotics to help patients maintain mobility and prevent serious complications that could lead to amputation.

SOC Definition: Assess, plan, and organize rehabilitative programs that help build or restore vocational, homemaking, and daily living skills, as well as general independence, to persons with disabilities or developmental delays. They work with patients to rebuild essential life skills like cooking, dressing, and working while addressing physical, cognitive, and emotional challenges. OTs often specialize in areas such as pediatrics, mental health, or rehabilitation following stroke or traumatic injury.

SOC Definition: Assess, plan, organize, and participate in rehabilitative programs that improve mobility, relieve pain, increase strength, and improve or correct disabling conditions resulting from disease or injury.

They use hands-on techniques, therapeutic exercises, and specialized equipment to help patients regain strength and mobility. PTs work in diverse settings from hospitals to sports clinics, treating conditions ranging from back pain to post-surgical recovery.

SOC Definition: Provide radiation therapy to patients as prescribed by a radiation oncologist according to established practices and standards. Duties may include reviewing prescription and diagnosis; acting as liaison with physician and supportive care personnel; preparing equipment, such as immobilization, treatment, and protection devices; and maintaining records, reports, and files. May assist in dosimetry procedures and tumor localization.
From Occupation Data: Provide radiation therapy to patients as prescribed by a radiation oncologist according to established practices and standards. Duties may include reviewing prescription and diagnosis; acting as liaison with physician and supportive care personnel; preparing equipment, such as immobilization, treatment, and protection devices; and maintaining records, reports, and files. May assist in dosimetry procedures and tumor localization.
Stacker Description: Radiation therapists deliver precise radiation treatments to cancer patients under the guidance of radiation oncologists. They operate sophisticated equipment, position patients carefully, and monitor treatments to ensure accuracy and safety. These healthcare professionals also maintain detailed records and may assist with treatment planning procedures that help target tumors while protecting healthy tissue.

SOC Definition: Plan, direct, or coordinate medically-approved recreation programs for patients in hospitals, nursing homes, or other institutions. Activities include sports, trips, dramatics, social activities, and crafts. May assess a patient condition and recommend appropriate recreational activity. Excludes “Recreation Workers” (39-9032).
From Occupation Data: Plan, direct, or coordinate medically-approved recreation programs for patients in hospitals, nursing homes, or other institutions. Activities include sports, trips, dramatics, social activities, and crafts. May assess a patient condition and recommend appropriate recreational activity.
Stacker Description: Recreational therapists design and lead therapeutic activities to help patients recover from illness, injury, or disability. Working in hospitals, rehabilitation centers, and nursing homes, they use sports, arts, games, and social activities as treatment tools. These professionals assess patients' needs and abilities to create personalized programs that improve physical, cognitive, and emotional well-being.

SOC Definition: Assess, treat, and care for patients with breathing disorders. Assume primary responsibility for all respiratory care modalities, including the supervision of respiratory therapy technicians. Initiate and conduct therapeutic procedures; maintain patient records; and select, assemble, check, and operate equipment.
From Occupation Data: Assess, treat, and care for patients with breathing disorders. Assume primary responsibility for all respiratory care modalities, including the supervision of respiratory therapy technicians. Initiate and conduct therapeutic procedures; maintain patient records; and select, assemble, check, and operate equipment.
Stacker Description: Respiratory therapists specialize in treating patients with breathing difficulties, from premature infants to elderly adults with chronic lung disease. They operate ventilators, administer breathing treatments, and perform diagnostic tests to assess lung function. These healthcare professionals work closely with doctors to develop treatment plans and often provide critical care in emergency situations.

SOC Definition: Assess and treat persons with speech, language, voice, and fluency disorders. May select alternative communication systems and teach their use. May perform research related to speech and language problems.
From Occupation Data: Assess and treat persons with speech, language, voice, and fluency disorders. May select alternative communication systems and teach their use. May perform research related to speech and language problems.
Stacker Description: Speech-language pathologists diagnose and treat communication disorders affecting speech, language, voice, and swallowing. They work with patients of all ages, from children with developmental delays to adults recovering from strokes. These professionals develop individualized therapy plans, teach alternative communication methods, and may conduct research to advance treatment techniques for various speech and language conditions.

SOC Definition: Assess, plan, or implement fitness programs that include exercise or physical activities such as those designed to improve cardiorespiratory function, body composition, muscular strength, muscular endurance, or flexibility. Excludes “Physical Therapists” (29-1123), “Athletic Trainers” (29-9091), and “Exercise Trainers and Group Fitness Instructors” (39-9031).
From Occupation Data: Assess, plan, or implement fitness programs that include exercise or physical activities such as those designed to improve cardiorespiratory function, body composition, muscular strength, muscular endurance, or flexibility.
Stacker Description: Exercise physiologists develop and implement fitness programs tailored to individuals' health needs and goals. They assess clients' physical capabilities, design safe and effective exercise routines, and monitor progress to improve cardiovascular health, strength, and flexibility. These professionals often work with people managing chronic diseases, helping them use exercise as medicine to improve their overall health outcomes.

SOC Definition: All therapists not listed separately.
From Occupation Data: All therapists not listed separately.
Stacker Description: This broad category encompasses specialized therapists who don't fit into traditional classifications, including art therapists, music therapists, and recreational therapists. These professionals use creative and alternative approaches to help patients overcome physical, emotional, or cognitive challenges. They work in hospitals, rehabilitation centers, schools, and private practices, developing innovative treatment plans tailored to individual patient needs and therapeutic goals.

SOC Definition: Diagnose, treat, or research diseases and injuries of animals. Includes veterinarians who conduct research and development, inspect livestock, or care for pets and companion animals.
From Occupation Data: Diagnose, treat, or research diseases and injuries of animals. Includes veterinarians who conduct research and development, inspect livestock, or care for pets and companion animals.
Stacker Description: Veterinarians diagnose and treat diseases, injuries, and health conditions in animals ranging from household pets to livestock and wildlife. They perform surgeries, prescribe medications, conduct health examinations, and advise pet owners on preventive care. Most veterinarians complete four years of veterinary school after earning a bachelor's degree and must pass national and state licensing examinations to practice.

SOC Definition: Assess patient health problems and needs, develop and implement nursing care plans, and maintain medical records. Administer nursing care to ill, injured, convalescent, or disabled patients. May advise patients on health maintenance and disease prevention or provide case management. Licensing or registration required. Includes Clinical Nurse Specialists. Excludes “Nurse Anesthetists” (29-1151), “Nurse Midwives” (29-1161), and “Nurse Practitioners” (29-1171).
From Occupation Data: Assess patient health problems and needs, develop and implement nursing care plans, and maintain medical records. Administer nursing care to ill, injured, convalescent, or disabled patients. May advise patients on health maintenance and disease prevention or provide case management. Licensing or registration required.
Stacker Description: Registered nurses form the backbone of healthcare, providing direct patient care and coordinating treatment plans across medical settings. They assess patient conditions, administer medications, monitor vital signs, and educate patients about health management. RNs must complete an accredited nursing program and pass the national licensing examination, with many pursuing specialized certifications in areas like critical care or pediatrics.

SOC Definition: Administer anesthesia, monitor patient’s vital signs, and oversee patient recovery from anesthesia. May assist anesthesiologists, surgeons, other physicians, or dentists. Must be registered nurses who have specialized graduate education.
From Occupation Data: Administer anesthesia, monitor patient's vital signs, and oversee patient recovery from anesthesia. May assist anesthesiologists, surgeons, other physicians, or dentists. Must be registered nurses who have specialized graduate education.
50 highest-paying jobs in America: Yes, a nurse anesthetist administers anesthesia. But that's just the beginning of what the job entails. These nurses also assist surgeons, physicians, and dentists and help patients recover from anesthesia. Along with earning a master's degree, nurse anesthetists also pass an exam and hold state licenses.
Stacker Description: Nurse anesthetists are advanced practice nurses who administer anesthesia during surgical procedures and monitor patients throughout operations. They work closely with surgeons and anesthesiologists, managing pain control and ensuring patient safety during critical moments. These highly trained professionals must complete specialized graduate education and certification programs beyond their registered nursing credentials.

SOC Definition: Diagnose and coordinate all aspects of the birthing process, either independently or as part of a healthcare team. May provide well-woman gynecological care. Must have specialized, graduate nursing education.
From Occupation Data: Diagnose and coordinate all aspects of the birthing process, either independently or as part of a healthcare team. May provide well-woman gynecological care. Must have specialized, graduate nursing education.
Stacker Description: Nurse midwives provide comprehensive care for women throughout pregnancy, childbirth, and postpartum recovery. They deliver babies, conduct prenatal examinations, and offer gynecological services including family planning counseling. These advanced practice nurses combine medical expertise with personalized care, often emphasizing natural birthing processes while maintaining the ability to handle emergency situations.

SOC Definition: Diagnose and treat acute, episodic, or chronic illness, independently or as part of a healthcare team. May focus on health promotion and disease prevention. May order, perform, or interpret diagnostic tests such as lab work and x rays. May prescribe medication. Must be registered nurses who have specialized graduate education.
From Occupation Data: Diagnose and treat acute, episodic, or chronic illness, independently or as part of a healthcare team. May focus on health promotion and disease prevention. May order, perform, or interpret diagnostic tests such as lab work and x rays. May prescribe medication. Must be registered nurses who have specialized graduate education.
Stacker Description: Nurse practitioners provide comprehensive healthcare services, diagnosing and treating illnesses while focusing on health promotion and disease prevention. They can order diagnostic tests, prescribe medications, and work independently or as part of medical teams. These advanced practice nurses must complete specialized graduate education beyond their registered nursing degree, making them vital healthcare providers who bridge the gap between doctors and traditional nurses.

SOC Definition: Assess and treat persons with hearing and related disorders. May fit hearing aids and provide auditory training. May perform research related to hearing problems.
From Occupation Data: Assess and treat persons with hearing and related disorders. May fit hearing aids and provide auditory training. May perform research related to hearing problems.
Stacker Description: Audiologists specialize in diagnosing and treating hearing disorders and related conditions that affect communication and balance. They conduct hearing tests, fit and program hearing aids, provide auditory rehabilitation training, and may conduct research on hearing-related problems. These healthcare professionals help patients of all ages improve their quality of life through better hearing and communication abilities.

SOC Definition: Administer anesthetics and analgesics for pain management prior to, during, or after surgery.
From Occupation Data: Administer anesthetics and analgesics for pain management prior to, during, or after surgery.
50 highest-paying jobs in America: Anaesthesiologists are medical specialists who focus on keeping patients' pain at bay during surgeries. They care for patients' well-being and keep them safe by administering medications that help manage pain and induce temporary loss of sensation or consciousness. The specialty requires four years of an anesthesiology residency after four years of medical school and an undergraduate degree.
Stacker Description: Anesthesiologists ensure patient safety and comfort during surgical procedures by administering anesthetics and managing pain before, during, and after operations. They monitor vital signs throughout surgery and adjust medications as needed. These highly trained physicians must complete medical school, a four-year anesthesiology residency, and often additional fellowship training in specialized areas like cardiac or pediatric anesthesia.

SOC Definition: Diagnose, treat, manage, and prevent diseases or conditions of the cardiovascular system. May further subspecialize in interventional procedures (e.g., balloon angioplasty and stent placement), echocardiography, or electrophysiology.
From Occupation Data: Diagnose, treat, manage, and prevent diseases or conditions of the cardiovascular system. May further subspecialize in interventional procedures (e.g., balloon angioplasty and stent placement), echocardiography, or electrophysiology.
50 highest-paying jobs in America: Cardiologists help prevent and treat heart and blood vessel diseases. Since the vocation plays a crucial role in patients' health (and mortality), this specialty requires at least 10 years of training plus passing an American Board of Internal Medicine exam and career-long continuing education.
Stacker Description: Cardiologists help prevent and treat heart and blood vessel diseases. Since the vocation plays a crucial role in patients' health (and mortality), this specialty requires at least 10 years of training plus passing an American Board of Internal Medicine exam and career-long continuing education.

SOC Definition: Diagnose and treat diseases relating to the skin, hair, and nails. May perform both medical and dermatological surgery functions.
From Occupation Data: Diagnose and treat diseases relating to the skin, hair, and nails. May perform both medical and dermatological surgery functions.
50 highest-paying jobs in America: Dermatologists undergo advanced medical training to diagnose and treat patients with skin, hair, and nail conditions. They provide therapies and perform surgeries, from testing for allergies and removing skin cancers, tattoos, and warts to conducting cosmetic procedures such as liposuction. Once a dermatologist has graduated from medical school, completed a residency program, and become American Board of Dermatology-certified and licensed in their state of practice, they have continuing education requirements.
Stacker Description: Dermatologists diagnose and treat conditions affecting the skin, hair, and nails, ranging from common issues like acne to serious diseases like skin cancer. They perform both medical treatments and surgical procedures, including cosmetic surgeries. These specialists complete medical school followed by a four-year dermatology residency, one of the most competitive medical specialties due to its combination of medical expertise and procedural skills.

SOC Definition: Make immediate medical decisions and act to prevent death or further disability. Provide immediate recognition, evaluation, care, stabilization, and disposition of patients. May direct emergency medical staff in an emergency department.
From Occupation Data: Make immediate medical decisions and act to prevent death or further disability. Provide immediate recognition, evaluation, care, stabilization, and disposition of patients. May direct emergency medical staff in an emergency department.
50 highest-paying jobs in America: Emergency medicine physicians are skilled, quick-thinking professionals who can make decisions and act immediately to prevent patients' deaths or further disability. These physicians have many specialties and subspecialties, from medical toxicology to underwater and hyperbaric medicine. It takes 11-12 years to become an EMP.
Stacker Description: Emergency medicine physicians work in high-pressure environments where split-second decisions can mean the difference between life and death. These doctors provide immediate care to patients with critical injuries, sudden illnesses, and life-threatening conditions. They must quickly assess, stabilize, and treat patients while coordinating with emergency medical teams and determining whether patients need specialized care or hospitalization.

SOC Definition: Diagnose, treat, and provide preventive care to individuals and families across the lifespan. May refer patients to specialists when needed for further diagnosis or treatment. Excludes “General Internal Medicine Physicians” (29-1216) and “Pediatricians, General” (29-1221).
From Occupation Data: Diagnose, treat, and provide preventive care to individuals and families across the lifespan. May refer patients to specialists when needed for further diagnosis or treatment.
50 highest-paying jobs in America: A family and general practitioner diagnoses, treats, and prevents common diseases instead of focusing on a specialized category of medicine. These physicians must complete all medical school and postsecondary education requirements.
Stacker Description: Family medicine physicians serve as the primary healthcare providers for patients of all ages, from newborns to elderly adults. They diagnose and treat a wide variety of common conditions, provide preventive care like vaccinations and screenings, and manage chronic diseases. When patients need specialized treatment beyond their scope, these doctors coordinate referrals to appropriate specialists while maintaining overall care coordination.

SOC Definition: Diagnose and provide nonsurgical treatment for a wide range of diseases and injuries of internal organ systems. Provide care mainly for adults and adolescents, and are based primarily in an outpatient care setting. Excludes “Family Medicine Physicians” (29-1215) and “Pediatricians, General” (29-1221).
From Occupation Data: Diagnose and provide nonsurgical treatment for a wide range of diseases and injuries of internal organ systems. Provide care mainly for adults and adolescents, and are based primarily in an outpatient care setting.
50 highest-paying jobs in America: General internists diagnose and treat afflictions pertaining to internal organ systems. Common ailments include hypertension, heart disease, and diabetes. Like other physicians, they must complete medical school and post-secondary training.
Stacker Description: General internal medicine physicians specialize in the comprehensive care of adults and adolescents, focusing on prevention, diagnosis, and non-surgical treatment of diseases affecting internal organs. Often called internists, they manage complex medical conditions like diabetes, heart disease, and autoimmune disorders primarily in outpatient settings. Their broad medical knowledge makes them skilled at diagnosing challenging cases and coordinating care.

SOC Definition: Diagnose, manage, and treat disorders and diseases of the brain, spinal cord, and peripheral nerves, with a primarily nonsurgical focus.
From Occupation Data: Diagnose, manage, and treat disorders and diseases of the brain, spinal cord, and peripheral nerves, with a primarily nonsurgical focus.
50 highest-paying jobs in America: The training to become a neurologist—a doctor who diagnoses and treats diseases of the brain, spinal cord, and peripheral nerves—is rigorous. The educational requirements include a bachelor's degree, a medical degree, a residency, and often a fellowship in a specialty such as brain injuries or geriatric care. Neurologists might treat strokes, epilepsy, Lou Gehrig's disease, Parkinson's disease, or brain tumors.
Stacker Description: Neurologists diagnose and treat disorders affecting the brain, spinal cord, and nervous system without performing surgery. They care for patients with conditions like epilepsy, multiple sclerosis, Parkinson's disease, and stroke. These specialists use advanced diagnostic tools including MRIs and electroencephalograms to identify neurological problems and develop treatment plans that may include medications, therapies, and lifestyle modifications.

SOC Definition: Provide medical care related to pregnancy or childbirth. Diagnose, treat, and help prevent diseases of women, particularly those affecting the reproductive system. May also provide general care to women. May perform both medical and gynecological surgery functions.
From Occupation Data: Provide medical care related to pregnancy or childbirth. Diagnose, treat, and help prevent diseases of women, particularly those affecting the reproductive system. May also provide general care to women. May perform both medical and gynecological surgery functions.
50 highest-paying jobs in America: Obstetricians and gynecologists provide a range of medical care services, particularly relating to the reproductive system. OBGYNs are known for being the critical specialists around pregnancy and childbirth, but they also diagnose, treat, and prevent disease in addition to performing surgeries. Becoming a board-certified OBGYN requires extensive education and training, including at least four years in an accredited residency program after medical school, with at least six months of experience in primary and preventive care.
Stacker Description: Obstetricians and gynecologists provide comprehensive healthcare for women throughout their lives, specializing in reproductive health, pregnancy, and childbirth. They perform routine gynecological exams, manage pregnancies from conception through delivery, and treat conditions affecting the female reproductive system. Many also perform surgical procedures ranging from cesarean sections to complex gynecological operations.

SOC Definition: Diagnose, treat, and help prevent diseases and injuries in children. May refer patients to specialists for further diagnosis or treatment, as needed. Excludes “Family Medicine Physicians” (29-1215) and “General Internal Medicine Physicians” (29-1216).
From Occupation Data: Diagnose, treat, and help prevent diseases and injuries in children. May refer patients to specialists for further diagnosis or treatment, as needed.
50 highest-paying jobs in America: General pediatricians are doctors who specialize in the care of children. While this can include diagnosing, treating, and preventing disease, pediatricians also provide general care, including checking children's growth and development. To work in pediatrics, a bachelor's degree and a medical degree are required, as well as an internship or residency.
