Stacker Description: General pediatricians provide comprehensive medical care for infants, children, and adolescents up to age 18. They conduct routine checkups, administer vaccinations, diagnose illnesses, and treat injuries while monitoring developmental milestones. These physicians often serve as the first point of contact for families, coordinating with specialists when complex conditions require additional expertise and building long-term relationships with patients throughout their formative years.

SOC Definition: Diagnose diseases and conduct lab tests using organs, body tissues, and fluids. Includes medical examiners.
From Occupation Data: Diagnose diseases and conduct lab tests using organs, body tissues, and fluids. Includes medical examiners.
50 highest-paying jobs in America: Pathologists are specialized medical professionals who don't often deal with patients directly but rather conduct lab tests using samples from organs, body tissues, and fluids to help diagnose disease, provide treatment guidance, give prognoses, or determine the cause of death. The path to pathology takes around 11 years and requires medical school, a residency program, and board certification.
Stacker Description: Pathologists work behind the scenes to diagnose diseases by examining tissue samples, blood, and other bodily fluids under microscopes and through laboratory tests. They play a critical detective role in medicine, identifying cancers, infections, and genetic disorders that guide treatment decisions. Some pathologists also serve as medical examiners, determining causes of death in legal cases and providing crucial evidence for investigations.

SOC Definition: Diagnose, treat, and help prevent mental disorders. Excludes “Clinical and Counseling Psychologists” (19-3033) and “School Psychologists” (19-3034).
From Occupation Data: Diagnose, treat, and help prevent mental disorders.
50 highest-paying jobs in America: Psychiatrists are specialized physicians who diagnose, treat, and prevent emotional, mental, and behavioral disorders. While a psychiatrist provides therapy and counseling, similar to a psychologist, the differentiating factor is that a psychiatrist can prescribe medication. Besides completing medical school, psychiatrists are certified by the American Board of Psychiatry and Neurology.
Stacker Description: Psychiatrists diagnose and treat mental health disorders ranging from depression and anxiety to schizophrenia and bipolar disorder. Unlike psychologists, they can prescribe medications and often combine therapy with pharmaceutical interventions. These medical doctors complete specialized residency training in psychiatry and may subspecialize in areas like child psychiatry, addiction medicine, or forensic psychiatry to address specific patient populations and complex mental health challenges.

SOC Definition: Diagnose and treat diseases and injuries using medical imaging techniques, such as x rays, magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), nuclear medicine, and ultrasounds. May perform minimally invasive medical procedures and tests.
From Occupation Data: Diagnose and treat diseases and injuries using medical imaging techniques, such as x rays, magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), nuclear medicine, and ultrasounds. May perform minimally invasive medical procedures and tests.
50 highest-paying jobs in America: These doctors differ from other medical professionals in their use of imaging technologies, including X-rays and ultrasounds, which help diagnose and treat diseases and injuries. Radiologists report and interpret what is revealed via tests to help guide the referring doctor. As with other specialists, their education and training requirements add up to at least 13 years after high school, including American Board of Radiology certification and continuing education credits.
Stacker Description: Radiologists interpret medical images to diagnose diseases and injuries throughout the body. Using X-rays, CT scans, MRIs, and ultrasounds, they detect everything from broken bones to tumors and internal bleeding. Many radiologists also perform minimally invasive procedures like biopsies and catheter insertions. Their expertise in medical imaging technology makes them essential partners for other physicians in developing accurate diagnoses and treatment plans.

SOC Definition: All physicians not listed separately.
From Occupation Data: All physicians not listed separately.
Stacker Description: This broad category encompasses specialized physicians not classified elsewhere, including sports medicine doctors, occupational medicine physicians, and preventive medicine specialists. These doctors often focus on specific patient populations, work environments, or health conditions. Many combine clinical practice with research, public health initiatives, or corporate wellness programs, applying their medical expertise in non-traditional healthcare settings to promote health and prevent disease.

SOC Definition: Diagnose and perform surgery to treat and help prevent disorders and diseases of the eye. May also provide vision services for treatment including glasses and contacts. Excludes “Optometrists” (29-1041) and “Pediatric Surgeons” (29-1243).
From Occupation Data: Diagnose and perform surgery to treat and help prevent disorders and diseases of the eye. May also provide vision services for treatment including glasses and contacts.
50 highest-paying jobs in America: Ophthalmologists treat vision problems, prescribe glasses and contacts, and perform laser surgery. They also handle eye injuries and diagnose eye diseases. Some specialize in glaucoma, corneal disease, or reconstructive surgery.
Stacker Description: Ophthalmologists diagnose and treat eye diseases and disorders, performing surgeries ranging from cataract removal to retinal repairs. Beyond surgical procedures, they also provide comprehensive vision care, including prescribing glasses and contact lenses. These specialists complete four years of medical school followed by a one-year internship and three-year ophthalmology residency, with many pursuing additional fellowship training in subspecialties.

SOC Definition: Diagnose and perform surgery to treat and prevent rheumatic and other diseases in the musculoskeletal system. Excludes “Pediatric Surgeons” (29-1243).
From Occupation Data: Diagnose and perform surgery to treat and prevent rheumatic and other diseases in the musculoskeletal system.
50 highest-paying jobs in America: Orthopedic surgeons treat conditions involving the musculoskeletal system to improve their patients' quality of life. Some orthopedic oncologists remove life-threatening tumors. However, most care for patients with pain and mobility issues. To be recognized by the American Board of Orthopaedic Surgery, these surgeons must practice for 17 months and pass exams following medical school and a five-year residency.
Stacker Description: Orthopedic surgeons treat conditions involving the musculoskeletal system to improve their patients' quality of life. Some orthopedic oncologists remove life-threatening tumors. However, most care for patients with pain and mobility issues. To be recognized by the American Board of Orthopaedic Surgery, these surgeons must practice for 17 months and pass exams following medical school and a five-year residency.

SOC Definition: Diagnose and perform surgery to treat fetal abnormalities and birth defects, diseases, and injuries in fetuses, premature and newborn infants, children, and adolescents. Includes all pediatric surgical specialties and subspecialties. Excludes “Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons” (29-1022), “Ophthalmologists, Except Pediatric” (29-1241), and “Orthopedic Surgeons, Except Pediatric” (29-1242).
From Occupation Data: Diagnose and perform surgery to treat fetal abnormalities and birth defects, diseases, and injuries in fetuses, premature and newborn infants, children, and adolescents. Includes all pediatric surgical specialties and subspecialties.
50 highest-paying jobs in America:
Of the 50 highest-paying jobs in America, pediatric surgeons comprise one of only two careers that employ fewer than 1,200 people. They have one of the most arduous education and training paths of any physician and are responsible for detecting and treating abnormalities, diseases, and injuries in fetuses through adolescence.

Data reporting by Wade Zhou. Additional writing by Cu Fleshman. Copy editing by Paris Close.
Stacker Description: Of the 50 highest-paying jobs in America, pediatric surgeons comprise one of only two careers that employ fewer than 1,200 people. They have one of the most arduous education and training paths of any physician and are responsible for detecting and treating abnormalities, diseases, and injuries in fetuses through adolescence.

SOC Definition: All surgeons not listed separately. Excludes “Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons” (29-1022).
From Occupation Data: All surgeons not listed separately.
Stacker Description: This broad category encompasses surgical specialists not classified elsewhere, including plastic surgeons, neurosurgeons, and transplant surgeons. These highly trained physicians perform complex procedures requiring exceptional precision and years of specialized training. Each subspecialty demands unique expertise, from reconstructive surgery to life-saving organ transplants, making this one of medicine's most diverse and demanding fields.

SOC Definition: Diagnose, treat, and prevent disorders by stimulating specific acupuncture points within the body using acupuncture needles. May also use cups, nutritional supplements, therapeutic massage, acupressure, and other alternative health therapies. Excludes “Chiropractors” (29-1011).
From Occupation Data: Diagnose, treat, and prevent disorders by stimulating specific acupuncture points within the body using acupuncture needles. May also use cups, nutritional supplements, therapeutic massage, acupressure, and other alternative health therapies.
Stacker Description: Acupuncturists treat patients by inserting thin needles into specific points on the body to restore energy flow and promote healing. Many also incorporate complementary therapies like cupping, therapeutic massage, and nutritional counseling. Most states require completion of an accredited acupuncture program and passing the National Certification Commission for Acupuncture and Oriental Medicine exam for licensure.

SOC Definition: Administer oral hygiene care to patients. Assess patient oral hygiene problems or needs and maintain health records. Advise patients on oral health maintenance and disease prevention. May provide advanced care such as providing fluoride treatment or administering topical anesthesia.
From Occupation Data: Administer oral hygiene care to patients. Assess patient oral hygiene problems or needs and maintain health records. Advise patients on oral health maintenance and disease prevention. May provide advanced care such as providing fluoride treatment or administering topical anesthesia.
Stacker Description: Dental hygienists provide essential preventive oral care by cleaning teeth, examining patients for signs of disease, and educating them about proper dental hygiene. They take X-rays, apply fluoride treatments, and document patient health records. Most dental hygienists complete an associate degree program and must obtain licensure in their state to practice professionally.

SOC Title: Healthcare Diagnosing or Treating Practitioners, All Other
title_lower: healthcare diagnosing or treating practitioners, all other
SOC Definition: All healthcare diagnosing or treating practitioners not listed separately.
From Occupation Data: All healthcare diagnosing or treating practitioners not listed separately.
Stacker Description: This broad category encompasses specialized healthcare practitioners who diagnose and treat patients but don't fit into other defined medical classifications. These professionals may include clinical nurse specialists, genetic counselors, or practitioners in emerging medical fields. Their diverse roles require specialized training and often advanced degrees in their particular healthcare specialty.

SOC Definition: Perform complex medical laboratory tests for diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease. May train or supervise staff.
From Occupation Data: Perform complex medical laboratory tests for diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease. May train or supervise staff.
Stacker Description: Medical and clinical laboratory technologists perform sophisticated diagnostic tests that help doctors detect diseases, monitor treatments, and guide patient care decisions. They analyze blood, tissue, and other specimens using advanced equipment and may supervise laboratory staff. These professionals typically hold bachelor's degrees in medical technology or related fields and often pursue professional certification.

SOC Definition: Perform routine medical laboratory tests for the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease. May work under the supervision of a medical technologist.
From Occupation Data: Perform routine medical laboratory tests for the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease. May work under the supervision of a medical technologist.
Stacker Description: Medical and clinical laboratory technicians conduct routine diagnostic tests on patient specimens to support medical diagnoses and treatment plans. Working under supervision of technologists or laboratory managers, they prepare samples, operate testing equipment, and record results. Most technicians complete associate degree programs or certificate courses in medical laboratory technology.

SOC Definition: Conduct tests on pulmonary or cardiovascular systems of patients for diagnostic, therapeutic, or research purposes. May conduct or assist in electrocardiograms, cardiac catheterizations, pulmonary functions, lung capacity, and similar tests.
From Occupation Data: Conduct tests on pulmonary or cardiovascular systems of patients for diagnostic, therapeutic, or research purposes. May conduct or assist in electrocardiograms, cardiac catheterizations, pulmonary functions, lung capacity, and similar tests.
Stacker Description: Cardiovascular technologists and technicians perform diagnostic tests to evaluate heart and lung function, helping doctors diagnose and treat cardiovascular conditions. They conduct procedures like electrocardiograms, stress tests, and cardiac catheterizations. These healthcare professionals typically complete specialized training programs and may earn professional certifications in their specific area of cardiovascular technology.

SOC Definition: Produce ultrasonic recordings of internal organs for use by physicians. Includes vascular technologists. Excludes “Cardiovascular Technologists and Technicians” (29-2031).
From Occupation Data: Produce ultrasonic recordings of internal organs for use by physicians. Includes vascular technologists.
Stacker Description: Diagnostic medical sonographers use specialized ultrasound equipment to create images of internal organs, tissues, and blood flow that help physicians diagnose medical conditions. These healthcare professionals work directly with patients, positioning them correctly and operating sophisticated imaging technology. Most sonographers complete accredited programs ranging from one to four years and must demonstrate competency in anatomy, patient care, and equipment operation.

SOC Definition: Prepare, administer, and measure radioactive isotopes in therapeutic, diagnostic, and tracer studies using a variety of radioisotope equipment. Prepare stock solutions of radioactive materials and calculate doses to be administered by radiologists. Subject patients to radiation. Execute blood volume, red cell survival, and fat absorption studies following standard laboratory techniques.
From Occupation Data: Prepare, administer, and measure radioactive isotopes in therapeutic, diagnostic, and tracer studies using a variety of radioisotope equipment. Prepare stock solutions of radioactive materials and calculate doses to be administered by radiologists. Subject patients to radiation. Execute blood volume, red cell survival, and fat absorption studies following standard laboratory techniques.
Stacker Description: Nuclear medicine technologists work with radioactive materials to help diagnose and treat diseases. They prepare and administer radiopharmaceuticals, operate imaging equipment like gamma cameras, and perform specialized tests to track how organs function. These professionals must follow strict safety protocols when handling radioactive substances and typically complete specialized training programs in nuclear medicine technology.

SOC Definition: Take x-rays and CAT scans or administer nonradioactive materials into patient’s bloodstream for diagnostic or research purposes. Includes radiologic technologists and technicians who specialize in other scanning modalities. Excludes “Diagnostic Medical Sonographers” (29-2032) and “Magnetic Resonance Imaging Technologists” (29-2035).
From Occupation Data: Take x-rays and CAT scans or administer nonradioactive materials into patient's bloodstream for diagnostic or research purposes. Includes radiologic technologists and technicians who specialize in other scanning modalities.
Stacker Description: Radiologic technologists operate imaging equipment to create X-rays, CT scans, and other diagnostic images that help physicians identify injuries and diseases. They position patients correctly, adjust machine settings, and ensure image quality while minimizing radiation exposure. Most technologists complete accredited programs and must pass national certification exams to practice in this essential healthcare field.

SOC Definition: Operate Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) scanners. Monitor patient safety and comfort, and view images of area being scanned to ensure quality of pictures. May administer gadolinium contrast dosage intravenously. May interview patient, explain MRI procedures, and position patient on examining table. May enter into the computer data such as patient history, anatomical area to be scanned, orientation specified, and position of entry.
From Occupation Data: Operate Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) scanners. Monitor patient safety and comfort, and view images of area being scanned to ensure quality of pictures. May administer gadolinium contrast dosage intravenously. May interview patient, explain MRI procedures, and position patient on examining table. May enter into the computer data such as patient history, anatomical area to be scanned, orientation specified, and position of entry.
Stacker Description: MRI technologists operate magnetic resonance imaging machines to create detailed pictures of internal body structures without using radiation. They ensure patient safety in the powerful magnetic environment, monitor comfort during lengthy scans, and may administer contrast agents when needed. These specialists require specialized training to understand both the complex technology and safety protocols unique to MRI procedures.

SOC Definition: Generate radiation treatment plans, develop radiation dose calculations, communicate and supervise the treatment plan implementation, and consult with members of radiation oncology team.
From Occupation Data: Generate radiation treatment plans, develop radiation dose calculations, communicate and supervise the treatment plan implementation, and consult with members of radiation oncology team.
50 highest-paying jobs in America: Medical dosimetrists play a vital role in the field of cancer treatment. They work closely with doctors and other medical professionals to develop a unique radiation treatment plan for each patient, depending on their specific tumors and diagnoses. To become a medical dosimetrist, you'll need a bachelor's degree in medical dosimetry or a related field, as well as a certification from an accredited medical dosimetry program.
Stacker Description: Medical dosimetrists work as part of radiation oncology teams to develop precise treatment plans for cancer patients receiving radiation therapy. They calculate exact radiation doses, ensure treatments target tumors while protecting healthy tissue, and collaborate with radiation oncologists and medical physicists. This specialized role requires extensive knowledge of radiation physics, anatomy, and treatment planning software.

SOC Definition: Assess injuries and illnesses and administer basic emergency medical care. May transport injured or sick persons to medical facilities. Excludes “Paramedics” (29-2043), “Firefighters” (33-2011), and “Ambulance Drivers and Attendants, Except Emergency Medical Technicians” (53-3011).
From Occupation Data: Assess injuries and illnesses and administer basic emergency medical care. May transport injured or sick persons to medical facilities.
Stacker Description: Emergency medical technicians serve as first responders in medical crises, providing life-saving care at accident scenes and during transport to hospitals. They assess patients' conditions, perform CPR, control bleeding, and stabilize injuries using basic medical equipment. EMTs must complete state-approved training programs and pass certification exams, with many working for ambulance services, fire departments, or hospitals in high-pressure environments.

SOC Definition: Administer basic or advanced emergency medical care and assess injuries and illnesses. May administer medication intravenously, use equipment such as EKGs, or administer advanced life support to sick or injured individuals. Excludes “Emergency Medical Technicians” (29-2042) and “Ambulance Drivers and Attendants, Except Emergency Medical Technicians” (53-3011).
From Occupation Data: Administer basic or advanced emergency medical care and assess injuries and illnesses. May administer medication intravenously, use equipment such as EKGs, or administer advanced life support to sick or injured individuals.
Stacker Description: Paramedics represent the highest level of emergency medical technicians, equipped to perform advanced life-saving procedures in the field. They can administer medications, interpret EKGs, perform intubations, and use sophisticated medical equipment that basic EMTs cannot. Paramedics undergo extensive training beyond EMT certification and often serve as team leaders during emergency responses, making critical decisions that can mean the difference between life and death.

SOC Definition: Assist in the provision of food service and nutritional programs, under the supervision of a dietitian. May plan and produce meals based on established guidelines, teach principles of food and nutrition, or counsel individuals.
From Occupation Data: Assist in the provision of food service and nutritional programs, under the supervision of a dietitian. May plan and produce meals based on established guidelines, teach principles of food and nutrition, or counsel individuals.
Stacker Description: Dietetic technicians work alongside registered dietitians to promote healthy eating and nutrition education. They help plan and prepare meals in hospitals, schools, and nursing homes while ensuring dietary guidelines are met. These professionals also counsel patients about proper nutrition, teach cooking classes, and maintain food service records. Most dietetic technicians complete associate degree programs and may pursue certification through the Commission on Dietetic Registration.

SOC Definition: Prepare medications under the direction of a pharmacist. May measure, mix, count out, label, and record amounts and dosages of medications according to prescription orders.
From Occupation Data: Prepare medications under the direction of a pharmacist. May measure, mix, count out, label, and record amounts and dosages of medications according to prescription orders.
Stacker Description: Pharmacy technicians work behind the scenes to ensure patients receive accurate medications safely and efficiently. Under pharmacist supervision, they count pills, measure liquid medications, label prescription bottles, and manage inventory. They also interact with customers, process insurance claims, and maintain patient records. Most pharmacy technicians complete on-the-job training or certificate programs, with many states requiring formal certification or registration.

SOC Definition: Care for individuals with mental or emotional conditions or disabilities, following the instructions of physicians or other health practitioners. Monitor patients’ physical and emotional well-being and report to medical staff. May participate in rehabilitation and treatment programs, help with personal hygiene, and administer oral or injectable medications.
From Occupation Data: Care for individuals with mental or emotional conditions or disabilities, following the instructions of physicians or other health practitioners. Monitor patients' physical and emotional well-being and report to medical staff. May participate in rehabilitation and treatment programs, help with personal hygiene, and administer oral or injectable medications.
Stacker Description: Psychiatric technicians provide essential care for individuals experiencing mental health challenges or developmental disabilities. They monitor patients' behavior and emotional states, assist with daily activities like bathing and eating, and help implement treatment plans developed by psychiatrists and other mental health professionals. These compassionate caregivers work in psychiatric hospitals, residential facilities, and community mental health centers, requiring specialized training in mental health care.

SOC Definition: Assist in operations, under the supervision of surgeons, registered nurses, or other surgical personnel. May help set up operating room, prepare and transport patients for surgery, adjust lights and equipment, pass instruments and other supplies to surgeons and surgeons’ assistants, hold retractors, cut sutures, and help count sponges, needles, supplies, and instruments. Excludes “Surgical Assistants” (29-9093).
From Occupation Data: Assist in operations, under the supervision of surgeons, registered nurses, or other surgical personnel. May help set up operating room, prepare and transport patients for surgery, adjust lights and equipment, pass instruments and other supplies to surgeons and surgeons' assistants, hold retractors, cut sutures, and help count sponges, needles, supplies, and instruments.
Stacker Description: Surgical technologists serve as the essential support team in operating rooms, ensuring surgeries run smoothly and safely. They prepare operating rooms, sterilize equipment, and assist surgeons by passing instruments and supplies during procedures. These professionals also help position patients, adjust lighting, and maintain accurate counts of surgical materials to prevent complications.

SOC Definition: Perform medical tests in a laboratory environment for use in the treatment and diagnosis of diseases in animals. Prepare vaccines and serums for prevention of diseases. Prepare tissue samples, take blood samples, and execute laboratory tests, such as urinalysis and blood counts. Clean and sterilize instruments and materials and maintain equipment and machines. May assist a veterinarian during surgery.
From Occupation Data: Perform medical tests in a laboratory environment for use in the treatment and diagnosis of diseases in animals. Prepare vaccines and serums for prevention of diseases. Prepare tissue samples, take blood samples, and execute laboratory tests, such as urinalysis and blood counts. Clean and sterilize instruments and materials and maintain equipment and machines. May assist a veterinarian during surgery.
Stacker Description: Veterinary technologists and technicians perform crucial diagnostic work to help treat animal patients. They conduct laboratory tests, prepare vaccines, collect blood and tissue samples, and assist veterinarians during surgical procedures. These skilled professionals also maintain and sterilize medical equipment, ensuring veterinary practices operate efficiently while providing quality care for animals.

SOC Definition: Assist ophthalmologists by performing ophthalmic clinical functions. May administer eye exams, administer eye medications, and instruct the patient in care and use of corrective lenses.
From Occupation Data: Assist ophthalmologists by performing ophthalmic clinical functions. May administer eye exams, administer eye medications, and instruct the patient in care and use of corrective lenses.
Stacker Description: Ophthalmic medical technicians work alongside eye doctors to provide comprehensive vision care. They conduct preliminary eye examinations, administer medications, and teach patients how to properly use contact lenses and other corrective devices. These specialized technicians play a vital role in helping ophthalmologists diagnose and treat various eye conditions and diseases.

SOC Title: Licensed Practical and Licensed Vocational Nurses
title_lower: licensed practical and licensed vocational nurses
SOC Definition: Care for ill, injured, or convalescing patients or persons with disabilities in hospitals, nursing homes, clinics, private homes, group homes, and similar institutions. May work under the supervision of a registered nurse. Licensing required.
From Occupation Data: Care for ill, injured, or convalescing patients or persons with disabilities in hospitals, nursing homes, clinics, private homes, group homes, and similar institutions. May work under the supervision of a registered nurse. Licensing required.
Stacker Description: Licensed practical and vocational nurses provide hands-on patient care in hospitals, nursing homes, and other healthcare facilities. Working under registered nurse supervision, they monitor patients' conditions, administer medications, assist with daily activities, and offer comfort to those recovering from illness or injury. State licensing ensures these nurses meet professional standards.

SOC Definition: Compile, process, and maintain medical records of hospital and clinic patients in a manner consistent with medical, administrative, ethical, legal, and regulatory requirements of the healthcare system. Classify medical and healthcare concepts, including diagnosis, procedures, medical services, and equipment, into the healthcare industry’s numerical coding system. Includes medical coders. Excludes “Health Information Technologists and Medical Registrars” (29-9021) and “File Clerks” (43-4071).
From Occupation Data: Compile, process, and maintain medical records of hospital and clinic patients in a manner consistent with medical, administrative, ethical, legal, and regulatory requirements of the healthcare system. Classify medical and healthcare concepts, including diagnosis, procedures, medical services, and equipment, into the healthcare industry's numerical coding system. Includes medical coders.
Stacker Description: Medical records specialists maintain the critical documentation that keeps healthcare systems functioning properly. They organize patient files, ensure records comply with legal and regulatory requirements, and translate medical diagnoses and procedures into standardized coding systems. This behind-the-scenes work supports billing, insurance claims, and continuity of patient care across healthcare providers.

SOC Definition: Design, measure, fit, and adapt lenses and frames for client according to written optical prescription or specification. Assist client with inserting, removing, and caring for contact lenses. Assist client with selecting frames. Measure customer for size of eyeglasses and coordinate frames with facial and eye measurements and optical prescription. Prepare work order for optical laboratory containing instructions for grinding and mounting lenses in frames. Verify exactness of finished lens spectacles. Adjust frame and lens position to fit client. May shape or reshape frames. Includes contact lens opticians.
From Occupation Data: Design, measure, fit, and adapt lenses and frames for client according to written optical prescription or specification. Assist client with inserting, removing, and caring for contact lenses. Assist client with selecting frames. Measure customer for size of eyeglasses and coordinate frames with facial and eye measurements and optical prescription. Prepare work order for optical laboratory containing instructions for grinding and mounting lenses in frames. Verify exactness of finished lens spectacles. Adjust frame and lens position to fit client. May shape or reshape frames. Includes contact lens opticians.
Stacker Description: Dispensing opticians help customers see clearly by fitting eyeglasses and contact lenses according to prescriptions from eye doctors. They measure faces and eyes to ensure proper fit, select appropriate frames, and coordinate with optical laboratories for lens grinding. These professionals also teach customers how to insert and care for contact lenses, adjust frames for comfort, and verify that finished eyewear meets prescription specifications.

SOC Definition: Design, measure, fit, and adapt orthopedic braces, appliances or prostheses, such as limbs or facial parts for patients with disabling conditions.
From Occupation Data: Design, measure, fit, and adapt orthopedic braces, appliances or prostheses, such as limbs or facial parts for patients with disabling conditions.
Stacker Description: Orthotists and prosthetists design and fit custom medical devices that restore mobility and function for people with disabilities or injuries. They create orthopedic braces, artificial limbs, and specialized appliances tailored to each patient's unique needs. These healthcare professionals combine technical expertise with compassionate care, helping patients regain independence through precisely fitted prosthetic devices and supportive braces.

SOC Definition: Select and fit hearing aids for customers. Administer and interpret tests of hearing. Assess hearing instrument efficacy. Take ear impressions and prepare, design, and modify ear molds. Excludes “Audiologists” (29-1181).
From Occupation Data: Select and fit hearing aids for customers. Administer and interpret tests of hearing. Assess hearing instrument efficacy. Take ear impressions and prepare, design, and modify ear molds.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: If a person needs a hearing aid, one of these specialists will likely help conduct a hearing test and help fit the hearing aid. Hearing aid specialists work alongside audiologists to do technical work like taking ear impressions and modifying ear molds, typically in a doctor's office or hospital.
Stacker Description: Hearing aid specialists help people with hearing loss by selecting, fitting, and adjusting hearing devices. They conduct hearing tests, take ear impressions, and create custom ear molds for optimal comfort and sound quality. These professionals also educate patients on proper hearing aid care and maintenance, ensuring devices function effectively to improve their clients' ability to communicate and engage with the world around them.

SOC Title: Health Technologists and Technicians, All Other
title_lower: health technologists and technicians, all other
SOC Definition: All health technologists and technicians not listed separately.
From Occupation Data: All health technologists and technicians not listed separately.
Stacker Description: Health technologists and technicians encompass a diverse group of medical support professionals who perform specialized tasks across various healthcare settings. These skilled workers operate medical equipment, conduct diagnostic tests, assist with patient care, and support clinical operations. Their specialized training allows them to work in emerging healthcare fields and adapt to new medical technologies as the industry evolves.

SOC Title: Health Information Technologists and Medical Registrars
title_lower: health information technologists and medical registrars
SOC Definition: Apply knowledge of healthcare and information systems to assist in the design, development, and continued modification and analysis of computerized healthcare systems. Abstract, collect, and analyze treatment and followup information of patients. May educate staff and assist in problem solving to promote the implementation of the healthcare information system. May design, develop, test, and implement databases with complete history, diagnosis, treatment, and health status to help monitor diseases. Excludes “Medical Records Specialists” (29‐2072).
From Occupation Data: Apply knowledge of healthcare and information systems to assist in the design, development, and continued modification and analysis of computerized healthcare systems. Abstract, collect, and analyze treatment and followup information of patients. May educate staff and assist in problem solving to promote the implementation of the healthcare information system. May design, develop, test, and implement databases with complete history, diagnosis, treatment, and health status to help monitor diseases.
Stacker Description: Health information technologists bridge the gap between healthcare and technology by designing and managing electronic medical record systems. They collect and analyze patient data, create databases to track treatment outcomes, and help healthcare facilities implement new information systems. These professionals play a crucial role in modern medicine by ensuring accurate health records and supporting evidence-based medical decisions through data analysis.

SOC Definition: Evaluate and treat musculoskeletal injuries or illnesses. Provide preventive, therapeutic, emergency, and rehabilitative care. Excludes “Physical Therapists” (29-1123).
From Occupation Data: Evaluate and treat musculoskeletal injuries or illnesses. Provide preventive, therapeutic, emergency, and rehabilitative care.
Stacker Description: Athletic trainers work on the front lines of sports medicine, preventing and treating injuries for athletes at all levels. They assess musculoskeletal problems, provide emergency care during games, and develop rehabilitation programs to help athletes return to peak performance. Most athletic trainers earn a master's degree from an accredited program and must pass a national certification exam to practice professionally.

SOC Definition: Assess individual or family risk for a variety of inherited conditions, such as genetic disorders and birth defects. Provide information to other healthcare providers or to individuals and families concerned with the risk of inherited conditions. Advise individuals and families to support informed decisionmaking and coping methods for those at risk. May help conduct research related to genetic conditions or genetic counseling.
From Occupation Data: Assess individual or family risk for a variety of inherited conditions, such as genetic disorders and birth defects. Provide information to other healthcare providers or to individuals and families concerned with the risk of inherited conditions. Advise individuals and families to support informed decisionmaking and coping methods for those at risk. May help conduct research related to genetic conditions or genetic counseling.
Stacker Description: Genetic counselors bridge the gap between complex genetic science and patient care by helping individuals and families understand their risk for inherited conditions. They interpret genetic test results, explain treatment options, and provide emotional support during difficult decisions. This specialized field typically requires a master's degree in genetic counseling and certification through the American Board of Genetic Counseling.

SOC Definition: Assist in operations, under the supervision of surgeons. May, in accordance with state laws, help surgeons to make incisions and close surgical sites, manipulate or remove tissues, implant surgical devices or drains, suction the surgical site, place catheters, clamp or cauterize vessels or tissue, and apply dressings to surgical site. Excludes “Registered Nurses” (29-1141) and “Surgical Technologists” (29-2055).
From Occupation Data: Assist in operations, under the supervision of surgeons. May, in accordance with state laws, help surgeons to make incisions and close surgical sites, manipulate or remove tissues, implant surgical devices or drains, suction the surgical site, place catheters, clamp or cauterize vessels or tissue, and apply dressings to surgical site.
Stacker Description: Surgical assistants work alongside surgeons in operating rooms, performing critical tasks that ensure procedures run smoothly and safely. Under direct supervision, they may make incisions, suture wounds, control bleeding, and handle surgical instruments. These healthcare professionals typically complete specialized training programs and must maintain certification while working in one of medicine's most demanding environments.

SOC Title: Healthcare Practitioners and Technical Workers, All Other
title_lower: healthcare practitioners and technical workers, all other
SOC Definition: All healthcare practitioners and technical workers not listed separately.
From Occupation Data: All healthcare practitioners and technical workers not listed separately.
Stacker Description: This diverse category encompasses emerging and specialized healthcare roles that don't fit traditional classifications, from perfusionists who operate heart-lung machines to orthotic technicians who craft custom medical devices. These professionals often require specialized training or certification and play increasingly important roles as healthcare technology advances and patient needs become more complex.

SOC Definition: Monitor the health status of an individual with disabilities or illness, and address their health-related needs, such as changing bandages, dressing wounds, or administering medication. Work is performed under the direction of offsite or intermittent onsite licensed nursing staff. Provide assistance with routine healthcare tasks or activities of daily living, such as feeding, bathing, toileting, or ambulation. May also help with tasks such as preparing meals, doing light housekeeping, and doing laundry depending on the patient’s abilities.
From Occupation Data: Monitor the health status of an individual with disabilities or illness, and address their health-related needs, such as changing bandages, dressing wounds, or administering medication. Work is performed under the direction of offsite or intermittent onsite licensed nursing staff. Provide assistance with routine healthcare tasks or activities of daily living, such as feeding, bathing, toileting, or ambulation. May also help with tasks such as preparing meals, doing light housekeeping, and doing laundry depending on the patient's abilities.
Stacker Description: Home health aides provide essential personal care services that allow people with disabilities or chronic illnesses to remain in their homes rather than institutional settings. They assist with daily activities like bathing, medication management, and wound care while offering companionship and monitoring patients' health status. Most states require certification, and the role demands both medical knowledge and compassionate interpersonal skills.

SOC Definition: Provide personalized assistance to individuals with disabilities or illness who require help with personal care and activities of daily living support (e.g., feeding, bathing, dressing, grooming, toileting, and ambulation). May also provide help with tasks such as preparing meals, doing light housekeeping, and doing laundry. Work is performed in various settings depending on the needs of the care recipient and may include locations such as their home, place of work, out in the community, or at a daytime nonresidential facility.
From Occupation Data: Provide personalized assistance to individuals with disabilities or illness who require help with personal care and activities of daily living support (e.g., feeding, bathing, dressing, grooming, toileting, and ambulation). May also provide help with tasks such as preparing meals, doing light housekeeping, and doing laundry. Work is performed in various settings depending on the needs of the care recipient and may include locations such as their home, place of work, out in the community, or at a daytime nonresidential facility.
Stacker Description: Personal care aides provide essential support to individuals with disabilities or chronic illnesses who need assistance with daily activities like bathing, dressing, meal preparation, and light housekeeping. They work in diverse settings including clients' homes, community locations, and day facilities. This role requires patience, compassion, and physical stamina, as aides help maintain their clients' independence and dignity while ensuring their safety and comfort.

SOC Definition: Provide or assist with basic care or support under the direction of onsite licensed nursing staff. Perform duties such as monitoring of health status, feeding, bathing, dressing, grooming, toileting, or ambulation of patients in a health or nursing facility. May include medication administration and other health-related tasks. Includes nursing care attendants, nursing aides, and nursing attendants. Excludes “Home Health Aides” (31-1121), “Personal Care Aides” (31-1122), “Orderlies” (31-1132), and “Psychiatric Aides” (31-1133).
From Occupation Data: Provide or assist with basic care or support under the direction of onsite licensed nursing staff. Perform duties such as monitoring of health status, feeding, bathing, dressing, grooming, toileting, or ambulation of patients in a health or nursing facility. May include medication administration and other health-related tasks. Includes nursing care attendants, nursing aides, and nursing attendants.
Stacker Description: Nursing assistants work under licensed nursing supervision to provide fundamental patient care in hospitals, nursing homes, and healthcare facilities. They monitor patients' vital signs, assist with personal hygiene, help with mobility, and may administer basic medications. These healthcare workers serve as the primary daily contact for many patients, requiring strong communication skills and the ability to handle physically and emotionally demanding situations.

SOC Definition: Transport patients to areas such as operating rooms or x-ray rooms using wheelchairs, stretchers, or moveable beds. May maintain stocks of supplies or clean and transport equipment. Excludes “Nursing Assistants” (31-1131). Psychiatric orderlies are included in “Psychiatric Aides” (31-1133).
From Occupation Data: Transport patients to areas such as operating rooms or x-ray rooms using wheelchairs, stretchers, or moveable beds. May maintain stocks of supplies or clean and transport equipment. Psychiatric orderlies are included in Psychiatric Aides.
Stacker Description: Orderlies ensure smooth operations in healthcare facilities by safely transporting patients between departments using wheelchairs, stretchers, and hospital beds. They also maintain medical supply inventories and clean equipment between uses. This role requires physical strength and attention to detail, as orderlies play a crucial part in patient safety during transfers to operating rooms, imaging departments, and other treatment areas.

SOC Definition: Assist mentally impaired or emotionally disturbed patients, working under direction of nursing and medical staff. May assist with daily living activities, lead patients in educational and recreational activities, or accompany patients to and from examinations and treatments. May restrain violent patients. Includes psychiatric orderlies.
From Occupation Data: Assist mentally impaired or emotionally disturbed patients, working under direction of nursing and medical staff. May assist with daily living activities, lead patients in educational and recreational activities, or accompany patients to and from examinations and treatments. May restrain violent patients. Includes psychiatric orderlies.
Stacker Description: Psychiatric aides support patients with mental health conditions under the supervision of medical and nursing staff. They assist with daily living activities, facilitate educational and recreational programs, and provide companionship during medical appointments. The role can be challenging, as aides may need to de-escalate situations and occasionally restrain patients experiencing violent episodes, requiring specialized training in mental health care techniques.

SOC Definition: Assist occupational therapists in providing occupational therapy treatments and procedures. May, in accordance with state laws, assist in development of treatment plans, carry out routine functions, direct activity programs, and document the progress of treatments. Generally requires formal training.
From Occupation Data: Assist occupational therapists in providing occupational therapy treatments and procedures. May, in accordance with state laws, assist in development of treatment plans, carry out routine functions, direct activity programs, and document the progress of treatments. Generally requires formal training.
Stacker Description: Occupational therapy assistants help patients regain independence by implementing treatment plans designed by licensed occupational therapists. They guide patients through therapeutic activities, document progress, and may lead specialized programs focused on improving daily living skills. This role requires formal training and offers the rewarding opportunity to witness patients overcome physical, mental, or developmental challenges to achieve greater autonomy.

SOC Definition: Under close supervision of an occupational therapist or occupational therapy assistant, perform only delegated, selected, or routine tasks in specific situations. These duties include preparing patient and treatment room.
From Occupation Data: Under close supervision of an occupational therapist or occupational therapy assistant, perform only delegated, selected, or routine tasks in specific situations. These duties include preparing patient and treatment room.
Stacker Description: Occupational therapy aides work under close supervision to support patient care in rehabilitation settings. They prepare treatment rooms, organize equipment, and help patients get ready for therapy sessions. While they don't provide direct treatment, their behind-the-scenes work ensures occupational therapists can focus on delivering specialized care to help patients regain independence in daily activities.

SOC Definition: Assist physical therapists in providing physical therapy treatments and procedures. May, in accordance with state laws, assist in the development of treatment plans, carry out routine functions, document the progress of treatment, and modify specific treatments in accordance with patient status and within the scope of treatment plans established by a physical therapist. Generally requires formal training.
From Occupation Data: Assist physical therapists in providing physical therapy treatments and procedures. May, in accordance with state laws, assist in the development of treatment plans, carry out routine functions, document the progress of treatment, and modify specific treatments in accordance with patient status and within the scope of treatment plans established by a physical therapist. Generally requires formal training.
Stacker Description: Physical therapist assistants work directly with patients to implement treatment plans developed by licensed physical therapists. They guide patients through exercises, apply therapeutic techniques, and monitor progress during recovery from injuries or surgeries. Most states require formal training through an accredited program, and assistants can modify treatments within established parameters based on patient responses.

SOC Definition: Under close supervision of a physical therapist or physical therapy assistant, perform only delegated, selected, or routine tasks in specific situations. These duties include preparing the patient and the treatment area.
From Occupation Data: Under close supervision of a physical therapist or physical therapy assistant, perform only delegated, selected, or routine tasks in specific situations. These duties include preparing the patient and the treatment area.
Stacker Description: Physical therapist aides provide essential support in rehabilitation clinics by preparing patients and treatment areas for therapy sessions. Working under direct supervision, they handle routine tasks like setting up equipment, maintaining clean treatment spaces, and helping patients transition between activities. Their organizational skills help physical therapy teams operate efficiently and focus on patient care.

SOC Definition: Perform therapeutic massages of soft tissues and joints. May assist in the assessment of range of motion and muscle strength, or propose client therapy plans.
From Occupation Data: Perform therapeutic massages of soft tissues and joints. May assist in the assessment of range of motion and muscle strength, or propose client therapy plans.
Stacker Description: Massage therapists use hands-on techniques to manipulate soft tissues and joints, helping clients manage pain, reduce stress, and improve circulation. They assess muscle tension and range of motion, then apply various massage techniques tailored to individual needs. Many work in spas, wellness centers, or healthcare facilities, and most states require licensing and continuing education.

SOC Definition: Perform limited clinical duties under the direction of a dentist. Clinical duties may include equipment preparation and sterilization, preparing patients for treatment, assisting the dentist during treatment, and providing patients with instructions for oral healthcare procedures. May perform administrative duties such as scheduling appointments, maintaining medical records, billing, and coding information for insurance purposes.
From Occupation Data: Perform limited clinical duties under the direction of a dentist. Clinical duties may include equipment preparation and sterilization, preparing patients for treatment, assisting the dentist during treatment, and providing patients with instructions for oral healthcare procedures. May perform administrative duties such as scheduling appointments, maintaining medical records, billing, and coding information for insurance purposes.
Stacker Description: Dental assistants multitask between clinical and administrative duties to keep dental practices running smoothly. They prepare patients for procedures, sterilize instruments, assist dentists during treatments, and provide post-care instructions. Many also handle scheduling, billing, and insurance coding. Most learn through on-the-job training or short-term certificate programs, making this an accessible healthcare career.

SOC Definition: Perform administrative and certain clinical duties under the direction of a physician. Administrative duties may include scheduling appointments, maintaining medical records, billing, and coding information for insurance purposes. Clinical duties may include taking and recording vital signs and medical histories, preparing patients for examination, drawing blood, and administering medications as directed by physician. Excludes “Physician Assistants” (29-1071).
From Occupation Data: Perform administrative and certain clinical duties under the direction of a physician. Administrative duties may include scheduling appointments, maintaining medical records, billing, and coding information for insurance purposes. Clinical duties may include taking and recording vital signs and medical histories, preparing patients for examination, drawing blood, and administering medications as directed by physician.
Stacker Description: Medical assistants serve as vital bridges between patients and physicians, handling both administrative and clinical responsibilities. They schedule appointments, maintain medical records, and process insurance billing while also taking vital signs, drawing blood, and preparing patients for examinations. Most medical assistants complete postsecondary education programs, though some learn through on-the-job training in physicians' offices and healthcare facilities.

SOC Definition: Prepare, sterilize, install, or clean laboratory or healthcare equipment. May perform routine laboratory tasks and operate or inspect equipment.
From Occupation Data: Prepare, sterilize, install, or clean laboratory or healthcare equipment. May perform routine laboratory tasks and operate or inspect equipment.
Stacker Description: Medical equipment preparers ensure healthcare facilities operate safely and efficiently by sterilizing, cleaning, and maintaining critical medical instruments and laboratory equipment. They perform routine equipment inspections, prepare surgical tools for procedures, and may conduct basic laboratory tasks. This behind-the-scenes role requires attention to detail and knowledge of proper sterilization protocols to prevent infections and equipment failures.

SOC Definition: Transcribe medical reports recorded by physicians and other healthcare practitioners using various electronic devices, covering office visits, emergency room visits, diagnostic imaging studies, operations, chart reviews, and final summaries. Transcribe dictated reports and translate abbreviations into fully understandable form. Edit as necessary and return reports in either printed or electronic form for review and signature, or correction.
From Occupation Data: Transcribe medical reports recorded by physicians and other healthcare practitioners using various electronic devices, covering office visits, emergency room visits, diagnostic imaging studies, operations, chart reviews, and final summaries. Transcribe dictated reports and translate abbreviations into fully understandable form. Edit as necessary and return reports in either printed or electronic form for review and signature, or correction.
Stacker Description: Medical transcriptionists convert recorded medical reports from physicians and healthcare practitioners into accurate written documents. They listen to dictated notes from office visits, surgeries, and diagnostic procedures, translating medical abbreviations and terminology into comprehensive reports. These professionals must possess strong listening skills, medical vocabulary knowledge, and typing proficiency to ensure patient records remain precise and legally compliant.

SOC Definition: Record drugs delivered to the pharmacy, store incoming merchandise, and inform the supervisor of stock needs. May operate cash register and accept prescriptions for filling.
From Occupation Data: Record drugs delivered to the pharmacy, store incoming merchandise, and inform the supervisor of stock needs. May operate cash register and accept prescriptions for filling.
Stacker Description: Pharmacy aides support pharmacists and pharmacy technicians by managing inventory, organizing medications, and handling basic customer service tasks. They receive and stock pharmaceutical deliveries, operate cash registers, and accept prescription orders from customers. While entry-level positions typically require only a high school diploma, pharmacy aides must understand medication storage requirements and maintain accurate inventory records.

SOC Title: Veterinary Assistants and Laboratory Animal Caretakers
title_lower: veterinary assistants and laboratory animal caretakers
SOC Definition: Feed, water, and examine pets and other nonfarm animals for signs of illness, disease, or injury in laboratories and animal hospitals and clinics. Clean and disinfect cages and work areas, and sterilize laboratory and surgical equipment. May provide routine postoperative care, administer medication orally or topically, or prepare samples for laboratory examination under the supervision of veterinary or laboratory animal technologists or technicians, veterinarians, or scientists. Excludes “Animal Caretakers” (39-2021).
From Occupation Data: Feed, water, and examine pets and other nonfarm animals for signs of illness, disease, or injury in laboratories and animal hospitals and clinics. Clean and disinfect cages and work areas, and sterilize laboratory and surgical equipment. May provide routine postoperative care, administer medication orally or topically, or prepare samples for laboratory examination under the supervision of veterinary or laboratory animal technologists or technicians, veterinarians, or scientists.
Stacker Description: Veterinary assistants and laboratory animal caretakers provide essential support in animal hospitals, clinics, and research facilities. They feed and monitor animals for signs of illness, clean enclosures, sterilize equipment, and assist with basic medical procedures under veterinary supervision. This hands-on role requires compassion for animals, physical stamina, and the ability to handle stressed or injured pets safely.

SOC Definition: Draw blood for tests, transfusions, donations, or research. May explain the procedure to patients and assist in the recovery of patients with adverse reactions.
From Occupation Data: Draw blood for tests, transfusions, donations, or research. May explain the procedure to patients and assist in the recovery of patients with adverse reactions.
Stacker Description: Phlebotomists draw blood samples for medical testing, transfusions, donations, and research purposes. These healthcare professionals must put patients at ease during what can be an uncomfortable procedure, explaining each step while ensuring proper technique to avoid complications. They also monitor patients for adverse reactions and provide immediate care when needed.

SOC Definition: All healthcare support workers not listed separately.
From Occupation Data: All healthcare support workers not listed separately.
Stacker Description: Healthcare support workers encompass a diverse range of professionals who provide essential services in medical settings. This broad category includes roles like medical equipment preparers, patient transporters, and various specialized assistants who help keep healthcare facilities running smoothly. These workers often serve as the backbone of medical operations, ensuring patients receive comprehensive care.

SOC Definition: Directly supervise and coordinate activities of correctional officers and jailers.
From Occupation Data: Directly supervise and coordinate activities of correctional officers and jailers.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: First-line supervisors of correctional officers oversee the activities of correctional officers in jails and prisons. Most are employed by state and local governments. California and Texas boast the largest number of jobs for these supervisors.
Stacker Description: First-line supervisors of correctional officers manage daily operations within jails, prisons, and detention facilities. They coordinate staff schedules, oversee security protocols, and ensure inmates are housed safely and securely. These supervisors handle disciplinary issues among both staff and inmates while maintaining institutional order and compliance with regulations.

SOC Title: First-Line Supervisors of Police and Detectives
title_lower: first-line supervisors of police and detectives

SOC Definition: Control and extinguish fires or respond to emergency situations where life, property, or the environment is at risk. Duties may include fire prevention, emergency medical service, hazardous material response, search and rescue, and disaster assistance.
From Occupation Data: Control and extinguish fires or respond to emergency situations where life, property, or the environment is at risk. Duties may include fire prevention, emergency medical service, hazardous material response, search and rescue, and disaster assistance.

Most complete extensive training at fire academies and maintain certifications in CPR and emergency medical techniques.

SOC Definition: Inspect buildings to detect fire hazards and enforce local ordinances and state laws, or investigate and gather facts to determine cause of fires and explosions.

SOC Title: Forest Fire Inspectors and Prevention Specialists
title_lower: forest fire inspectors and prevention specialists

From Occupation Data: Enforce fire regulations, inspect forest for fire hazards, and recommend forest fire prevention or control measures. May report forest fires and weather conditions.

These employees not only inspect woods and forests for fire hazards, but they also enforce regulations and recommend fire control methods.
Stacker Description: Forest fire inspectors and prevention specialists protect wilderness areas by monitoring fire hazards and enforcing safety regulations in forests and wildlands. They patrol remote areas, assess weather conditions, and educate the public about fire prevention. During fire season, these specialists coordinate with firefighting crews, report dangerous conditions, and implement controlled burns to reduce fuel loads that could spark devastating wildfires.

SOC Definition: Maintain order in courts of law.
From Occupation Data: Maintain order in courts of law.

They escort defendants, manage evidence, and enforce court rules while judges and attorneys conduct business. These law enforcement officers also serve legal documents and may transport prisoners between facilities. Most bailiffs complete police academy training or have prior law enforcement experience before specializing in court security.

SOC Definition: Guard inmates in penal or rehabilitative institutions in accordance with established regulations and procedures. May guard prisoners in transit between jail, courtroom, prison, or other point. Includes deputy sheriffs and police who spend the majority of their time guarding prisoners in correctional institutions.

They conduct searches, monitor prisoner activities, and escort inmates to various locations within facilities. These officers also write reports on incidents and inmate behavior. The role requires physical and mental resilience, as officers work in potentially dangerous environments with strict protocols.

SOC Definition: Conduct investigations related to suspected violations of federal, state, or local laws to prevent or solve crimes. Excludes “Private Detectives and Investigators” (33-9021).
From Occupation Data: Conduct investigations related to suspected violations of federal, state, or local laws to prevent or solve crimes.

They specialize in areas like fraud, homicide, or cybercrime, working closely with forensic experts and other law enforcement agencies. These professionals spend considerable time reviewing documents, conducting surveillance, and building cases for prosecution. Strong analytical skills and attention to detail are essential.

SOC Definition: Patrol assigned area to prevent fish and game law violations. Investigate reports of damage to crops or property by wildlife. Compile biological data.
From Occupation Data: Patrol assigned area to prevent fish and game law violations. Investigate reports of damage to crops or property by wildlife. Compile biological data.

The job combines law enforcement duties with outdoor work, requiring both legal knowledge and understanding of wildlife behavior.

SOC Definition: Patrol assigned area, such as public parking lot or city streets to issue tickets to overtime parking violators and illegally parked vehicles.

SOC Definition: Maintain order and protect life and property by enforcing local, tribal, state, or federal laws and ordinances. SOC Definition: Protect and police railroad and transit property, employees, or passengers.
From Occupation Data: Protect and police railroad and transit property, employees, or passengers.

Stacker Description: Transit and railroad police specialize in protecting transportation systems, their employees, and passengers from crime and safety threats. SOC Title: Gambling Surveillance Officers and Gambling Investigators

SOC Definition: Sell or solicit advertising space, time, or media in publications, signage, TV, radio, or Internet establishments or public spaces.

SOC Definition: Plan and sell transportation and accommodations for customers. Determine destination, modes of transportation, travel dates, costs, and accommodations required. May also describe, plan, and arrange itineraries and sell tour packages. May assist in resolving clients’ travel problems.

SOC Definition: Locate and notify customers of delinquent accounts by mail, telephone, or personal visit to solicit payment. SOC Definition: In a gambling establishment, conduct financial transactions for patrons. May reconcile daily summaries of transactions to balance books. May sell gambling chips, tokens, or tickets to patrons, or to other workers for resale to patrons. SOC Definition: Perform duties related to the purchase, sale, or holding of securities. SOC Definition: Perform any combination of tasks in a United States Postal Service (USPS) post office, such as receive letters and parcels; sell postage and revenue stamps, postal cards, and stamped envelopes; fill out and sell money orders; place mail in pigeon holes of mail rack or in bags; and examine mail for correct postage. title_lower: postal service mail sorters, processors, and processing machine operators

SOC Definition: Coordinate and expedite the flow of work and materials within or between departments of an establishment according to production schedule. Excludes “Project Management Specialists” (13-1082) and “Weighers, Measurers, Checkers, and Samplers, Recordkeeping” (43-5111).

SOC Definition: Verify and maintain records on incoming and outgoing shipments involving inventory. SOC Title: Executive Secretaries and Executive Administrative Assistants
title_lower: executive secretaries and executive administrative assistants

SOC Definition: Perform secretarial duties using specific knowledge of medical terminology and hospital, clinic, or laboratory procedures. Duties may include scheduling appointments, billing patients, and compiling and recording medical charts, reports, and correspondence.

SOC Definition: Perform duties too varied and diverse to be classified in any specific office clerical occupation, requiring knowledge of office systems and procedures. SOC Definition: Compile and compute data according to statistical formulas for use in statistical studies. May perform actuarial computations and compile charts and graphs for use by actuaries. Includes actuarial clerks.

SOC Title: First-Line Supervisors of Farming, Fishing, and Forestry Workers
title_lower: first-line supervisors of farming, fishing, and forestry workers

SOC Definition: Inspect agricultural commodities, processing equipment, and facilities, and fish and logging operations, to ensure compliance with regulations and laws governing health, quality, and safety.

SOC Definition: Select and breed animals according to their genealogy, characteristics, and offspring. May require knowledge of artificial insemination techniques and equipment use. May involve keeping records on heats, birth intervals, or pedigree. Many use artificial insemination techniques and maintain detailed records of bloodlines. This specialized work requires deep knowledge of animal genetics, reproduction, and husbandry practices.

SOC Definition: Grade, sort, or classify unprocessed food and other agricultural products by size, weight, color, or condition. Excludes “Agricultural Inspectors” (45-2011).

SOC Definition: Drive and control equipment to support agricultural activities such as tilling soil; planting, cultivating, and harvesting crops; feeding and herding livestock; or removing animal waste. SOC Title: Farmworkers and Laborers, Crop, Nursery, and Greenhouse

SOC Definition: Attend to live farm, ranch, open range or aquacultural animals that may include cattle, sheep, swine, goats, horses and other equines, poultry, rabbits, finfish, shellfish, and bees. Attend to animals produced for animal products, such as meat, fur, skins, feathers, eggs, milk, and honey. Duties may include feeding, watering, herding, grazing, milking, castrating, branding, de-beaking, weighing, catching, and loading animals. May maintain records on animals; examine animals to detect diseases and injuries; assist in birth deliveries; and administer medications, vaccinations, or insecticides as appropriate. May clean and maintain animal housing areas. Includes workers who shear wool from sheep and collect eggs in hatcheries.
From Occupation Data: Attend to live farm, ranch, open range or aquacultural animals that may include cattle, sheep, swine, goats, horses and other equines, poultry, rabbits, finfish, shellfish, and bees. They assist with births, administer medications, maintain clean living environments, and perform specialized tasks like shearing sheep or collecting eggs from commercial hatcheries.

SOC Definition: All agricultural workers not listed separately.
From Occupation Data: All agricultural workers not listed separately.

SOC Definition: Hunt, trap, catch, or gather wild animals or aquatic animals and plants. May use nets, traps, or other equipment. May haul catch onto ship or other vessel. Aquacultural laborers who work on fish farms are included in “Farmworkers, Farm, Ranch, and Aquacultural Animals” (45-2093).
From Occupation Data: Hunt, trap, catch, or gather wild animals or aquatic animals and plants. May use nets, traps, or other equipment. May haul catch onto ship or other vessel.

They use specialized equipment like nets, traps, and boats to catch fish, shellfish, and other marine life, or hunt game animals. These workers often operate in challenging outdoor conditions and must understand wildlife behavior, seasonal patterns, and conservation regulations while ensuring sustainable harvesting practices.

SOC Definition: Under supervision, perform manual labor necessary to develop, maintain, or protect areas such as forests, forested areas, woodlands, wetlands, and rangelands through such activities as raising and transporting seedlings; combating insects, pests, and diseases harmful to plant life; and building structures to control water, erosion, and leaching of soil. Includes forester aides, seedling pullers, tree planters, and gatherers of nontimber forestry products such as pine straw.
From Occupation Data: Under supervision, perform manual labor necessary to develop, maintain, or protect areas such as forests, forested areas, woodlands, wetlands, and rangelands through such activities as raising and transporting seedlings; combating insects, pests, and diseases harmful to plant life; and building structures to control water, erosion, and leaching of soil. Includes forester aides, seedling pullers, tree planters, and gatherers of nontimber forestry products such as pine straw.

Working under supervision in forests, wetlands, and rangelands, these workers play a vital role in preserving ecosystems and supporting sustainable forestry practices.

SOC Definition: Use axes or chainsaws to fell trees using knowledge of tree characteristics and cutting techniques to control direction of fall and minimize tree damage.
From Occupation Data: Use axes or chainsaws to fell trees using knowledge of tree characteristics and cutting techniques to control direction of fall and minimize tree damage.
Stacker Description: Fallers are skilled tree-cutting specialists who use chainsaws and axes to safely bring down trees in logging operations. They must possess deep knowledge of tree characteristics, cutting techniques, and physics to control exactly where and how a tree falls, minimizing damage to surrounding vegetation and ensuring worker safety in dangerous forest environments.

SOC Definition: Drive logging tractor or wheeled vehicle equipped with one or more accessories, such as bulldozer blade, frontal shear, grapple, logging arch, cable winches, hoisting rack, or crane boom, to fell tree; to skid, load, unload, or stack logs; or to pull stumps or clear brush. Includes operating stand-alone logging machines, such as log chippers. Logging truck drivers are included in “Heavy and Tractor-Trailer Truck Drivers” (53-3032).
From Occupation Data: Drive logging tractor or wheeled vehicle equipped with one or more accessories, such as bulldozer blade, frontal shear, grapple, logging arch, cable winches, hoisting rack, or crane boom, to fell tree; to skid, load, unload, or stack logs; or to pull stumps or clear brush. Includes operating stand-alone logging machines, such as log chippers.
