They drive specialized tractors and vehicles equipped with bulldozer blades, grapples, winches, and cranes to fell trees, move logs, clear brush, and load timber. These operators also run stand-alone machines like log chippers, requiring technical expertise to navigate challenging terrain safely.

SOC Definition: Grade logs or estimate the marketable content or value of logs or pulpwood in sorting yards, millpond, log deck, or similar locations. Inspect logs for defects or measure logs to determine volume. Excludes “Buyers and Purchasing Agents, Farm Products” (13-1021).
From Occupation Data: Grade logs or estimate the marketable content or value of logs or pulpwood in sorting yards, millpond, log deck, or similar locations. Inspect logs for defects or measure logs to determine volume.
Stacker Description: Log graders and scalers assess the quality and commercial value of harvested timber. They inspect logs for defects, measure dimensions to calculate volume, and sort wood based on grade standards. Working in sorting yards, millponds, and log decks, these professionals ensure accurate pricing and proper allocation of timber for various manufacturing purposes.

SOC Definition: All logging workers not listed separately.
From Occupation Data: All logging workers not listed separately.
Stacker Description: Logging workers handle the specialized tasks that keep timber operations running smoothly beyond the typical tree-cutting roles. These professionals may operate heavy machinery, maintain equipment, transport logs, or perform safety inspections in forest environments. The work demands physical stamina and technical skills while navigating challenging outdoor conditions and strict safety protocols.

SOC Title: First-Line Supervisors of Construction Trades and Extraction Workers
title_lower: first-line supervisors of construction trades and extraction workers
SOC Definition: Directly supervise and coordinate activities of construction or extraction workers.
From Occupation Data: Directly supervise and coordinate activities of construction or extraction workers.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: First-line supervisors of construction trades and extraction workers supervise workers at construction sites for residential homes, commercial properties, civil projects, and more. Like all jobs in the construction industry, employment opportunities for first-line supervisors are projected to grow alongside the industry.
Stacker Description: First-line supervisors coordinate construction and extraction crews, ensuring projects meet deadlines, safety standards, and quality requirements. They assign tasks, monitor progress, and troubleshoot problems on job sites ranging from building construction to mining operations. These supervisors bridge the gap between upper management and frontline workers, requiring both technical expertise and strong leadership skills.

SOC Definition: Construct, assemble, maintain, and repair stationary steam boilers and boiler house auxiliaries. Align structures or plate sections to assemble boiler frame tanks or vats, following blueprints. Work involves use of hand and power tools, plumb bobs, levels, wedges, dogs, or turnbuckles. Assist in testing assembled vessels. Direct cleaning of boilers and boiler furnaces. Inspect and repair boiler fittings, such as safety valves, regulators, automatic-control mechanisms, water columns, and auxiliary machines.
From Occupation Data: Construct, assemble, maintain, and repair stationary steam boilers and boiler house auxiliaries. Align structures or plate sections to assemble boiler frame tanks or vats, following blueprints. Work involves use of hand and power tools, plumb bobs, levels, wedges, dogs, or turnbuckles. Assist in testing assembled vessels. Direct cleaning of boilers and boiler furnaces. Inspect and repair boiler fittings, such as safety valves, regulators, automatic-control mechanisms, water columns, and auxiliary machines.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: After completing an apprenticeship, boilermakers install, assemble, repair, and maintain boilers in buildings ranging from apartments to offices to construction sites. This work is physically demanding and can require lots of travel, so prospective applicants will have to think carefully about whether they want to take it on.
Stacker Description: Boilermakers construct and maintain the massive steam boilers that power industrial facilities and ships. Using specialized tools and following precise blueprints, they assemble heavy metal components, test pressure vessels, and perform critical safety inspections. This demanding trade requires welding expertise, physical strength, and meticulous attention to detail since faulty boilers can cause catastrophic accidents.

SOC Definition: Lay and bind building materials, such as brick, structural tile, concrete block, cinder block, glass block, and terra-cotta block, with mortar and other substances, to construct or repair walls, partitions, arches, sewers, and other structures. Installers of mortarless segmental concrete masonry wall units are classified in “Landscaping and Groundskeeping Workers” (37-3011). Excludes “Stonemasons” (47-2022).
From Occupation Data: Lay and bind building materials, such as brick, structural tile, concrete block, cinder block, glass block, and terra-cotta block, with mortar and other substances, to construct or repair walls, partitions, arches, sewers, and other structures.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: Brickmasons and blockmasons build walls, arches, and other structures out of bricks or other blocks. Brickmasons tend to work primarily on residential properties, while blockmasons often work on larger commercial projects. The field is projected to grow 9.7% from 2018 to 2028.
Stacker Description: Brickmasons and blockmasons create durable structures by laying brick, concrete blocks, and other masonry materials with mortar. They build everything from residential walls to commercial buildings, sewers, and decorative archways. The craft demands precision, physical endurance, and an eye for detail, as these workers must ensure structures are both aesthetically pleasing and structurally sound.

SOC Definition: Build stone structures, such as piers, walls, and abutments. Lay walks, curbstones, or special types of masonry for vats, tanks, and floors.
From Occupation Data: Build stone structures, such as piers, walls, and abutments. Lay walks, curbstones, or special types of masonry for vats, tanks, and floors.
Stacker Description: Stonemasons craft enduring structures from natural and artificial stone, building everything from decorative walls to functional infrastructure like bridge supports. They cut, shape, and position heavy stone materials to create both utilitarian and artistic works. This ancient trade combines physical strength with artistic skill, requiring knowledge of stone properties and traditional building techniques.

SOC Definition: Construct, erect, install, or repair structures and fixtures made of wood and comparable materials, such as concrete forms; building frameworks, including partitions, joists, studding, and rafters; and wood stairways, window and door frames, and hardwood floors. May also install cabinets, siding, drywall, and batt or roll insulation. Includes brattice builders who build doors or brattices (ventilation walls or partitions) in underground passageways.
From Occupation Data: Construct, erect, install, or repair structures and fixtures made of wood and comparable materials, such as concrete forms; building frameworks, including partitions, joists, studding, and rafters; and wood stairways, window and door frames, and hardwood floors. Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: Though you don't need a college degree to become a carpenter, you will likely need to complete an apprenticeship or additional on-the-job training. Carpenters work on everything from interior home remodels to the construction of bridges and highways. Furthermore, the number of carpenter jobs is expected to grow 8% between 2018 and 2028, thanks to a boom in homebuilding.
Stacker Description: Carpenters build and repair structures using wood and similar materials, from framing houses to installing cabinets and hardwood floors. They construct everything from basic partitions and door frames to complex staircases, often working on both residential and commercial projects. Many carpenters learn through apprenticeships or vocational training, developing skills in measuring, cutting, and joining materials with precision.

SOC Definition: Lay and install carpet from rolls or blocks on floors. Install padding and trim flooring materials. Excludes “Floor Layers, Except Carpet, Wood, and Hard Tiles” (47-2042).
From Occupation Data: Lay and install carpet from rolls or blocks on floors. Install padding and trim flooring materials.
Stacker Description: Carpet installers transform bare floors into comfortable living and working spaces by laying carpet from rolls or tiles. They measure rooms, cut materials to fit, install padding for comfort and durability, and trim edges for a professional finish. This skilled trade requires knowledge of different carpet types, proper stretching techniques, and the ability to work around obstacles like stairs and built-in furniture.

SOC Title: Floor Layers, Except Carpet, Wood, and Hard Tiles
title_lower: floor layers, except carpet, wood, and hard tiles
SOC Definition: Apply blocks, strips, or sheets of shock-absorbing, sound-deadening, or decorative coverings to floors.
From Occupation Data: Apply blocks, strips, or sheets of shock-absorbing, sound-deadening, or decorative coverings to floors.
Stacker Description: Floor layers specialize in installing resilient flooring materials like vinyl, linoleum, and rubber that provide shock absorption, sound dampening, or decorative appeal. They prepare surfaces, apply adhesives, and carefully position sheets or blocks to create seamless floors. SOC Definition: Scrape and sand wooden floors to smooth surfaces using floor scraper and floor sanding machine, and apply coats of finish.
From Occupation Data: Scrape and sand wooden floors to smooth surfaces using floor scraper and floor sanding machine, and apply coats of finish.
Stacker Description: Floor sanders and finishers restore wooden floors to their original beauty by removing old finishes and imperfections. Using specialized sanding machines, they smooth surfaces before applying protective coats of polyurethane, wax, or other finishes. This meticulous work requires understanding different wood types, grain patterns, and finishing products to achieve durable, attractive results.

SOC Definition: Apply hard tile, stone, and comparable materials to walls, floors, ceilings, countertops, and roof decks.
From Occupation Data: Apply hard tile, stone, and comparable materials to walls, floors, ceilings, countertops, and roof decks.
Stacker Description: Tile and stone setters create durable, attractive surfaces by installing ceramic, porcelain, marble, and other hard materials on floors, walls, and countertops. They cut tiles to fit spaces, apply adhesives and grout, and ensure proper alignment and spacing. This precise work demands artistic skill for pattern layouts and technical knowledge of waterproofing and substrate preparation.

SOC Definition: Smooth and finish surfaces of poured concrete, such as floors, walks, sidewalks, roads, or curbs using a variety of hand and power tools. Align forms for sidewalks, curbs, or gutters; patch voids; and use saws to cut expansion joints. Installers of mortarless segmental concrete masonry wall units are classified in “Landscaping and Groundskeeping Workers” (37-3011).
From Occupation Data: Smooth and finish surfaces of poured concrete, such as floors, walks, sidewalks, roads, or curbs using a variety of hand and power tools. Align forms for sidewalks, curbs, or gutters; patch voids; and use saws to cut expansion joints.
Stacker Description: Cement masons and concrete finishers transform liquid concrete into smooth, durable surfaces for sidewalks, driveways, floors, and roads. Using hand and power tools, they level wet concrete, create expansion joints, and repair damaged areas. These skilled tradespeople must work quickly before concrete sets while ensuring precise alignment and proper finishing techniques for long-lasting results.

SOC Definition: Apply a mixture of cement, sand, pigment, or marble chips to floors, stairways, and cabinet fixtures to fashion durable and decorative surfaces.
From Occupation Data: Apply a mixture of cement, sand, pigment, or marble chips to floors, stairways, and cabinet fixtures to fashion durable and decorative surfaces.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: These workers produce terrazzo, a highly decorative building material known for its signature mosaic look. The dots of different colors within the terrazzo are the result of combining cement, sand, pigment, and marble chips. This specialized construction work isn't particularly common in the United States, and the bulk of the jobs for terrazzo workers can be found in California and Illinois.
Stacker Description: Terrazzo workers create decorative flooring by mixing cement with marble chips, sand, and pigments to produce stunning, durable surfaces. Found in upscale buildings, airports, and public spaces, terrazzo requires artistic skill and technical precision. Workers grind and polish the hardened surface to reveal intricate patterns and achieve the characteristic smooth, lustrous finish.

SOC Definition: Perform tasks involving physical labor at construction sites. May operate hand and power tools of all types: air hammers, earth tampers, cement mixers, small mechanical hoists, surveying and measuring equipment, and a variety of other equipment and instruments. May clean and prepare sites, dig trenches, set braces to support the sides of excavations, erect scaffolding, and clean up rubble, debris, and other waste materials. May assist other craft workers. Construction laborers who primarily assist a particular craft worker are classified under “Helpers, Construction Trades” (47-3010). Excludes “Hazardous Materials Removal Workers” (47-4041).
From Occupation Data: Perform tasks involving physical labor at construction sites. May operate hand and power tools of all types: air hammers, earth tampers, cement mixers, small mechanical hoists, surveying and measuring equipment, and a variety of other equipment and instruments. May clean and prepare sites, dig trenches, set braces to support the sides of excavations, erect scaffolding, and clean up rubble, debris, and other waste materials. May assist other craft workers.
Stacker Description: Construction laborers form the backbone of building projects, performing essential physical tasks that keep job sites running smoothly. They operate various tools and equipment, prepare construction areas, dig trenches, erect scaffolding, and assist skilled tradespeople. These versatile workers must be physically fit and safety-conscious while adapting to diverse tasks across different construction phases.

SOC Title: Paving, Surfacing, and Tamping Equipment Operators
title_lower: paving, surfacing, and tamping equipment operators
SOC Definition: Operate equipment used for applying concrete, asphalt, or other materials to road beds, parking lots, or airport runways and taxiways or for tamping gravel, dirt, or other materials. Includes concrete and asphalt paving machine operators, form tampers, tamping machine operators, and stone spreader operators.
From Occupation Data: Operate equipment used for applying concrete, asphalt, or other materials to road beds, parking lots, or airport runways and taxiways or for tamping gravel, dirt, or other materials. They operate complex paving machines, tampers, and spreaders while ensuring proper material distribution and surface quality. These operators must coordinate with construction crews and maintain precise control for smooth, even surfaces.

SOC Definition: Operate pile drivers mounted on skids, barges, crawler treads, or locomotive cranes to drive pilings for retaining walls, bulkheads, and foundations of structures such as buildings, bridges, and piers.
From Occupation Data: Operate pile drivers mounted on skids, barges, crawler treads, or locomotive cranes to drive pilings for retaining walls, bulkheads, and foundations of structures such as buildings, bridges, and piers.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: Pile driver operators drive large machines used to place piles, or vertical elements of deep foundations, for the construction of buildings, bridges, and other structures. As the construction industry grows from 2018 to 2028, jobs for pile drivers and other construction professionals are likely to become more prevalent.
Stacker Description: Pile driver operators use powerful mounted equipment to drive foundation pilings deep into the ground for major construction projects. Working on bridges, buildings, and waterfront structures, they position and operate heavy machinery with precision to ensure structural stability. This specialized role requires technical expertise and careful coordination in challenging environments.

SOC Title: Operating Engineers and Other Construction Equipment Operators
title_lower: operating engineers and other construction equipment operators
SOC Definition: Operate one or several types of power construction equipment, such as motor graders, bulldozers, scrapers, compressors, pumps, derricks, shovels, tractors, or front-end loaders to excavate, move, and grade earth, erect structures, or pour concrete or other hard surface pavement. May repair and maintain equipment in addition to other duties. Excludes “Extraction Workers” (47-5000) and “Crane and Tower Operators” (53-7021).
From Occupation Data: Operate one or several types of power construction equipment, such as motor graders, bulldozers, scrapers, compressors, pumps, derricks, shovels, tractors, or front-end loaders to excavate, move, and grade earth, erect structures, or pour concrete or other hard surface pavement. May repair and maintain equipment in addition to other duties.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: The job of operating engineers or other construction equipment operators likely involves some kind of heavy machinery, whether that's a bulldozer, compressor, front-end loader, or something else. Given the scale of equipment involved, it's no wonder that this job requires significant on-the-job training.

They operate bulldozers, excavators, cranes, and other powerful equipment to move earth, grade surfaces, and erect structures. Beyond operating machinery, many also handle equipment maintenance and repairs, making mechanical aptitude essential for success in this physically demanding field.

SOC Definition: Apply plasterboard or other wallboard to ceilings or interior walls of buildings. Apply or mount acoustical tiles or blocks, strips, or sheets of shock-absorbing materials to ceilings and walls of buildings to reduce or reflect sound. Materials may be of decorative quality. Includes lathers who fasten wooden, metal, or rockboard lath to walls, ceilings, or partitions of buildings to provide support base for plaster, fireproofing, or acoustical material. Excludes “Carpenters” (47-2031), “Carpet Installers” (47-2041), and “Tile and Stone Setters” (47-2044).
From Occupation Data: Apply plasterboard or other wallboard to ceilings or interior walls of buildings. Apply or mount acoustical tiles or blocks, strips, or sheets of shock-absorbing materials to ceilings and walls of buildings to reduce or reflect sound. Materials may be of decorative quality. Includes lathers who fasten wooden, metal, or rockboard lath to walls, ceilings, or partitions of buildings to provide support base for plaster, fireproofing, or acoustical material.
Stacker Description: Drywall and ceiling tile installers transform bare construction frames into finished interior spaces. They measure, cut, and mount wallboard to create smooth wall surfaces, while also installing acoustic tiles and sound-dampening materials. These skilled tradespeople must work with precision to ensure proper alignment and seamless joints that will provide the foundation for painting or wallpapering.

SOC Definition: Seal joints between plasterboard or other wallboard to prepare wall surface for painting or papering.
From Occupation Data: Seal joints between plasterboard or other wallboard to prepare wall surface for painting or papering.
Stacker Description: Tapers complete the finishing work that drywall installers begin, creating smooth, paint-ready surfaces throughout buildings. They apply joint compound to seams between wallboard panels, sand rough spots, and ensure walls are perfectly smooth. This detail-oriented work requires patience and skill, as any imperfections will show through paint or wallpaper once the project is complete.

SOC Definition: Install, maintain, and repair electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures. Ensure that work is in accordance with relevant codes. May install or service street lights, intercom systems, or electrical control systems. Excludes “Security and Fire Alarm Systems Installers” (49-2098).
From Occupation Data: Install, maintain, and repair electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures. Ensure that work is in accordance with relevant codes. May install or service street lights, intercom systems, or electrical control systems.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: Most electricians learn the trade through an apprenticeship, though smaller numbers attend vocational school. Nearly all electricians must be licensed by their state. The growth rate for the profession from 2018 to 2028 is projected to hit 10%, driven in part by the construction of new homes.
Stacker Description: Electricians install, maintain, and repair the electrical systems that power modern buildings and infrastructure. They work with wiring, outlets, circuit breakers, and lighting systems while ensuring all installations meet safety codes. From residential homes to commercial buildings and street lighting, electricians keep our electrical infrastructure functioning safely and efficiently through skilled troubleshooting and precise installation work.

SOC Definition: Install glass in windows, skylights, store fronts, and display cases, or on surfaces, such as building fronts, interior walls, ceilings, and tabletops.
From Occupation Data: Install glass in windows, skylights, store fronts, and display cases, or on surfaces, such as building fronts, interior walls, ceilings, and tabletops.
Stacker Description: Glaziers specialize in installing glass in windows, doors, skylights, and decorative surfaces throughout buildings. They measure openings precisely, cut glass to fit, and secure it using various mounting techniques and sealants. These skilled craftspeople work on everything from residential windows to elaborate storefront displays, requiring both technical precision and an eye for aesthetic detail.

SOC Title: Insulation Workers, Floor, Ceiling, and Wall
title_lower: insulation workers, floor, ceiling, and wall
SOC Definition: Line and cover structures with insulating materials. May work with batt, roll, or blown insulation materials.
From Occupation Data: Line and cover structures with insulating materials. May work with batt, roll, or blown insulation materials.
Stacker Description: Insulation workers specializing in floors, ceilings, and walls install materials that help buildings maintain comfortable temperatures and reduce energy costs. They work with various insulation types including batts, rolls, and blown materials, carefully fitting them into spaces to create thermal barriers. This physically demanding job requires attention to detail and knowledge of building codes to ensure proper installation.

SOC Definition: Apply insulating materials to pipes or ductwork, or other mechanical systems in order to help control and maintain temperature.
From Occupation Data: Apply insulating materials to pipes or ductwork, or other mechanical systems in order to help control and maintain temperature.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: Mechanical insulation workers install and replace the insulation in homes, offices, and other buildings, often working in extreme heat or cold. Between 2018 and 2028, jobs for insulation workers are projected to grow 5%—mirroring the nationwide average for all occupations.
Stacker Description: Mechanical insulation workers focus on pipes, ductwork, and HVAC systems to control temperature and prevent energy loss. They wrap boilers, steam pipes, and air conditioning systems with specialized materials to maintain efficiency and prevent condensation. This skilled trade requires understanding of mechanical systems and the ability to work in tight spaces within commercial and industrial buildings.

SOC Definition: Paint walls, equipment, buildings, bridges, and other structural surfaces, using brushes, rollers, and spray guns. May remove old paint to prepare surface prior to painting. May mix colors or oils to obtain desired color or consistency. Excludes “Paperhangers” (47-2142).
From Occupation Data: Paint walls, equipment, buildings, bridges, and other structural surfaces, using brushes, rollers, and spray guns. May remove old paint to prepare surface prior to painting. May mix colors or oils to obtain desired color or consistency.
Stacker Description: Construction and maintenance painters apply protective and decorative coatings to buildings, bridges, and equipment using brushes, rollers, and spray guns. They prepare surfaces by removing old paint, filling cracks, and priming before applying new finishes. These skilled workers must understand paint chemistry, color mixing, and surface preparation techniques to achieve professional, long-lasting results.

SOC Definition: Cover interior walls or ceilings of rooms with decorative wallpaper or fabric, or attach advertising posters on surfaces such as walls and billboards. May remove old materials or prepare surfaces to be papered.
From Occupation Data: Cover interior walls or ceilings of rooms with decorative wallpaper or fabric, or attach advertising posters on surfaces such as walls and billboards. May remove old materials or prepare surfaces to be papered.
Stacker Description: Paperhangers transform interior spaces by applying decorative wallpaper and fabric to walls and ceilings. They carefully measure, cut, and position materials while ensuring patterns align perfectly and seams are invisible. This detail-oriented trade requires steady hands, spatial awareness, and knowledge of adhesives to create flawless installations that enhance a room's aesthetic appeal.

SOC Definition: Lay pipe for storm or sanitation sewers, drains, and water mains. Perform any combination of the following tasks: grade trenches or culverts, position pipe, or seal joints. Excludes “Welders, Cutters, Solderers, and Brazers” (51-4121).
From Occupation Data: Lay pipe for storm or sanitation sewers, drains, and water mains. Perform any combination of the following tasks: grade trenches or culverts, position pipe, or seal joints.
Stacker Description: Pipelayers install underground pipe systems for water mains, storm drains, and sewer lines that keep communities functioning. They grade trenches, position heavy pipes using machinery, and seal joints to prevent leaks. This essential infrastructure work requires knowledge of hydraulics, soil conditions, and safety protocols while working in excavated areas.

SOC Definition: Assemble, install, alter, and repair pipelines or pipe systems that carry water, steam, air, or other liquids or gases. May install heating and cooling equipment and mechanical control systems. Includes sprinkler fitters.
From Occupation Data: Assemble, install, alter, and repair pipelines or pipe systems that carry water, steam, air, or other liquids or gases. May install heating and cooling equipment and mechanical control systems. Includes sprinkler fitters.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: Plumbers, pipefitters, and steamfitters install and repair the pipes that are so essential to indoor plumbing. Though only a high school diploma is needed to begin an on-the-job apprenticeship, some plumbers do attend vocational school. Additionally, most states require plumbers to be licensed.
Stacker Description: Plumbers, pipefitters, and steamfitters install and repair the intricate network of pipes that deliver water, gas, and steam throughout buildings. These skilled tradespeople work on everything from residential bathroom fixtures to complex industrial heating systems and fire sprinkler networks. Their expertise ensures safe water delivery and proper waste removal, making them essential to public health and building functionality.

SOC Definition: Apply interior or exterior plaster, cement, stucco, or similar materials. May also set ornamental plaster.
From Occupation Data: Apply interior or exterior plaster, cement, stucco, or similar materials. May also set ornamental plaster.
Stacker Description: Plasterers and stucco masons apply protective and decorative coatings to interior and exterior walls using plaster, cement, stucco, and similar materials. These craftspeople create smooth, durable surfaces that enhance both the appearance and weather resistance of buildings. Many also specialize in ornamental plasterwork, restoring historic details or creating custom decorative elements that add architectural character to structures.

SOC Definition: Position and secure steel bars or mesh in concrete forms in order to reinforce concrete. Use a variety of fasteners, rod-bending machines, blowtorches, and hand tools. Includes rod busters.
From Occupation Data: Position and secure steel bars or mesh in concrete forms in order to reinforce concrete. Use a variety of fasteners, rod-bending machines, blowtorches, and hand tools. Includes rod busters.

Stacker Description: Reinforcing iron and rebar workers strengthen concrete structures by positioning and securing steel bars and mesh within concrete forms. Using specialized tools like rod-bending machines and blowtorches, these workers create the internal skeleton that prevents concrete from cracking under stress. Their precise work is crucial for ensuring the structural integrity of everything from highway bridges to skyscrapers.

SOC Definition: Cover roofs of structures with shingles, slate, asphalt, aluminum, wood, or related materials. May spray roofs, sidings, and walls with material to bind, seal, insulate, or soundproof sections of structures.
From Occupation Data: Cover roofs of structures with shingles, slate, asphalt, aluminum, wood, or related materials. May spray roofs, sidings, and walls with material to bind, seal, insulate, or soundproof sections of structures.
Stacker Description: Roofers protect buildings from the elements by installing and repairing various roofing materials including shingles, slate, metal, and asphalt. SOC Definition: Fabricate, assemble, install, and repair sheet metal products and equipment, such as ducts, control boxes, drainpipes, and furnace casings. Work may involve any of the following: setting up and operating fabricating machines to cut, bend, and straighten sheet metal; shaping metal over anvils, blocks, or forms using hammer; operating soldering and welding equipment to join sheet metal parts; or inspecting, assembling, and smoothing seams and joints of burred surfaces. Includes sheet metal duct installers who install prefabricated sheet metal ducts used for heating, air conditioning, or other purposes.
From Occupation Data: Fabricate, assemble, install, and repair sheet metal products and equipment, such as ducts, control boxes, drainpipes, and furnace casings. Using cutting-edge machinery and traditional hand tools, they shape metal components and join them through welding and soldering. Their work is vital for heating, ventilation, and air conditioning systems that keep buildings comfortable and energy-efficient.

SOC Definition: Raise, place, and unite iron or steel girders, columns, and other structural members to form completed structures or structural frameworks. May erect metal storage tanks and assemble prefabricated metal buildings. Excludes “Reinforcing Iron and Rebar Workers” (47-2171).

Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: Structural iron and steel workers primarily work in the construction and contracting industry, placing iron and steel columns, girders, and structural pieces in buildings and other projects. The number of jobs for these workers is projected to grow 11% from 2018 to 2028, primarily due to the increase in commercial construction projects such as high-rise buildings. The COVID-19 pandemic has caused the commercial construction industry to contract, but studies suggest that it's well poised to recover from the crisis.

The physically demanding job requires precision, teamwork, and strict adherence to safety protocols in often challenging weather conditions.

SOC Definition: Assemble, install, or maintain solar photovoltaic (PV) systems on roofs or other structures in compliance with site assessment and schematics. May include measuring, cutting, assembling, and bolting structural framing and solar modules. May perform minor electrical work such as current checks. Excludes solar PV electricians who are included in “Electricians” (47-2111) and solar thermal installers who are included in “Plumbers, Pipefitters, and Steamfitters” (47-2152).
From Occupation Data: Assemble, install, or maintain solar photovoltaic (PV) systems on roofs or other structures in compliance with site assessment and schematics. SOC Definition: Inspect structures using engineering skills to determine structural soundness and compliance with specifications, building codes, and other regulations. Inspections may be general in nature or may be limited to a specific area, such as electrical systems or plumbing.

title_lower: elevator and escalator installers and repairers

SOC Definition: Identify, remove, pack, transport, or dispose of hazardous materials, including asbestos, lead-based paint, waste oil, fuel, transmission fluid, radioactive materials, or contaminated soil. SOC Definition: Maintain highways, municipal and rural roads, airport runways, and rights-of-way. Duties include patching broken or eroded pavement and repairing guard rails, highway markers, and snow fences. May also mow or clear brush from along road, or plow snow from roadway. Excludes “Tree Trimmers and Pruners” (37-3013).

SOC Title: Rail-Track Laying and Maintenance Equipment Operators
title_lower: rail-track laying and maintenance equipment operators

They operate specialized machinery to lay new track, replace worn rails, and ensure proper ballast distribution. These workers also use tamping machines to stabilize railroad beds and cleaning equipment to maintain track drainage. The role requires mechanical aptitude and the ability to work as part of coordinated crews on active railway systems.

SOC Title: Septic Tank Servicers and Sewer Pipe Cleaners

SOC Definition: Lay out, cut, and place segmental paving units. Includes installers of bedding and restraining materials for the paving units.

SOC Definition: Rig derrick equipment and operate pumps to circulate mud or fluid through drill hole.

They operate sophisticated pumping systems that circulate drilling fluids through boreholes, maintaining pressure and removing debris during the drilling process. SOC Title: Rotary Drill Operators, Oil and Gas
title_lower: rotary drill operators, oil and gas

SOC Title: Service Unit Operators, Oil and Gas
title_lower: service unit operators, oil and gas

SOC Title: Excavating and Loading Machine and Dragline Operators, Surface Mining

SOC Title: Earth Drillers, Except Oil and Gas
title_lower: earth drillers, except oil and gas

SOC Title: Explosives Workers, Ordnance Handling Experts, and Blasters
title_lower: explosives workers, ordnance handling experts, and blasters

SOC Definition: Operate self-propelled mining machines that rip coal, metal and nonmetal ores, rock, stone, or sand from the mine face and load it onto conveyors, shuttle cars, or trucks in a continuous operation.

From Occupation Data: Set up, operate, or tend heating equipment, such as heat-treating furnaces, flame-hardening machines, induction machines, soaking pits, or vacuum equipment to temper, harden, anneal, or heat treat metal or plastic objects.
Stacker Description: Heat treating equipment operators control furnaces and specialized machinery that alter the physical properties of metal and plastic materials. They operate flame-hardening machines, induction heaters, and vacuum equipment to strengthen, soften, or modify materials according to precise specifications. This process is crucial for creating durable components used in aerospace, automotive, and industrial applications.

SOC Definition: Lay out reference points and dimensions on metal or plastic stock or workpieces, such as sheets, plates, tubes, structural shapes, castings, or machine parts, for further processing. Includes shipfitters.
From Occupation Data: Lay out reference points and dimensions on metal or plastic stock or workpieces, such as sheets, plates, tubes, structural shapes, castings, or machine parts, for further processing. Includes shipfitters.
Stacker Description: Layout workers serve as the blueprint translators of manufacturing, marking precise reference points and measurements on raw metal and plastic materials. They use specialized tools to map out cutting lines, drilling locations, and assembly points on everything from steel plates to machine components. Their accuracy ensures that subsequent manufacturing steps produce parts that meet exact engineering specifications.

SOC Title: Plating Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic
title_lower: plating machine setters, operators, and tenders, metal and plastic
SOC Definition: Set up, operate, or tend plating machines to coat metal or plastic products with chromium, zinc, copper, cadmium, nickel, or other metal to protect or decorate surfaces. Typically, the product being coated is immersed in molten metal or an electrolytic solution. Excludes “Coating, Painting, and Spraying Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders” (51-9124).
From Occupation Data: Set up, operate, or tend plating machines to coat metal or plastic products with chromium, zinc, copper, cadmium, nickel, or other metal to protect or decorate surfaces. Typically, the product being coated is immersed in molten metal or an electrolytic solution.
Stacker Description: Plating machine operators apply protective and decorative metal coatings to manufactured products through electroplating and immersion processes. They operate equipment that coats items with chromium, zinc, nickel, and other metals to prevent corrosion, enhance appearance, or improve conductivity. This process is essential for automotive parts, electronics, and household items that require enhanced durability and aesthetics.

SOC Definition: Perform precision smoothing, sharpening, polishing, or grinding of metal objects.
From Occupation Data: Perform precision smoothing, sharpening, polishing, or grinding of metal objects.
Stacker Description: Tool grinders and sharpeners maintain the cutting edges and surfaces of industrial tools and equipment through precision grinding and polishing techniques. They restore worn drill bits, cutting tools, and machine components to exact specifications using specialized grinding equipment. Their expertise ensures that manufacturing tools operate efficiently and produce high-quality results across various industries.

SOC Title: Metal Workers and Plastic Workers, All Other
title_lower: metal workers and plastic workers, all other
SOC Definition: All metal workers and plastic workers not listed separately.
From Occupation Data: All metal workers and plastic workers not listed separately.
Stacker Description: Metal and plastic workers in this category encompass specialized craftspeople who don't fit into other defined occupations. They might fabricate custom metal components, operate injection molding equipment, or repair plastic products. These versatile workers often combine traditional metalworking skills with modern plastic fabrication techniques, adapting their expertise to meet specific industrial or commercial needs across various manufacturing sectors.

SOC Definition: Format and proof text and images submitted by designers and clients into finished pages that can be printed. Includes digital and photo typesetting. May produce printing plates.
From Occupation Data: Format and proof text and images submitted by designers and clients into finished pages that can be printed. Includes digital and photo typesetting. May produce printing plates.
Stacker Description: Prepress technicians bridge the gap between design and printing by preparing digital files for production. They format text and images, ensure color accuracy, and create printing plates or digital files that machines can read. These detail-oriented professionals troubleshoot technical issues, proof materials for errors, and work closely with designers and clients to ensure the final printed product matches the original vision.

SOC Definition: Set up and operate digital, letterpress, lithographic, flexographic, gravure, or other printing machines. Includes short-run offset printing presses.
From Occupation Data: Set up and operate digital, letterpress, lithographic, flexographic, gravure, or other printing machines. Includes short-run offset printing presses.
Stacker Description: Printing press operators bring designs to life by running the machines that produce everything from business cards to billboards. They set up equipment, mix inks, adjust settings for different materials, and monitor quality throughout production runs. These skilled technicians must understand various printing methods and troubleshoot mechanical issues while maintaining consistent output and meeting tight deadlines.

SOC Definition: Bind books and other publications or finish printed products by hand or machine. May set up binding and finishing machines.
From Occupation Data: Bind books and other publications or finish printed products by hand or machine. May set up binding and finishing machines.
Stacker Description: Print binding and finishing workers complete the final steps that transform printed sheets into finished products. They operate machines that cut, fold, stitch, and bind materials into books, magazines, and brochures. These workers also apply special finishes like lamination or embossing. Their attention to detail ensures publications are properly assembled and meet quality standards before reaching consumers.

SOC Definition: Operate or tend washing or dry-cleaning machines to wash or dry-clean industrial or household articles, such as cloth garments, suede, leather, furs, blankets, draperies, linens, rugs, and carpets. Includes spotters and dyers of these articles.
From Occupation Data: Operate or tend washing or dry-cleaning machines to wash or dry-clean industrial or household articles, such as cloth garments, suede, leather, furs, blankets, draperies, linens, rugs, and carpets. Includes spotters and dyers of these articles.
Stacker Description: Laundry and dry-cleaning workers maintain and restore textiles using specialized equipment and chemical processes. They sort items by fabric type and cleaning requirements, operate washing machines and dry-cleaning equipment, and treat stains or damage. These workers must understand different fabric care needs and safety protocols for handling cleaning chemicals while ensuring garments and household items are returned in pristine condition.

SOC Title: Pressers, Textile, Garment, and Related Materials
title_lower: pressers, textile, garment, and related materials
SOC Definition: Press or shape articles by hand or machine.
From Occupation Data: Press or shape articles by hand or machine.
Stacker Description: Pressers use specialized equipment and techniques to shape and smooth textiles, garments, and related materials. Working in manufacturing facilities, dry cleaners, and garment factories, they operate pressing machines or use hand irons to remove wrinkles, create sharp creases, and give finished products their final appearance. This hands-on work requires attention to detail and knowledge of different fabric types to avoid damage during the pressing process.

SOC Definition: Operate or tend sewing machines to join, reinforce, decorate, or perform related sewing operations in the manufacture of garment or nongarment products.
From Occupation Data: Operate or tend sewing machines to join, reinforce, decorate, or perform related sewing operations in the manufacture of garment or nongarment products.
Stacker Description: Sewing machine operators are the backbone of textile manufacturing, using industrial machines to stitch together everything from clothing to upholstery and technical fabrics. They join seams, attach decorative elements, and reinforce stress points on garments and non-garment products. These skilled workers must maintain consistent quality while meeting production quotas, often specializing in specific types of stitching or product categories within manufacturing facilities.

SOC Title: Shoe and Leather Workers and Repairers
title_lower: shoe and leather workers and repairers
SOC Definition: Construct, decorate, or repair leather and leather-like products, such as luggage, shoes, and saddles. May use hand tools.
From Occupation Data: Construct, decorate, or repair leather and leather-like products, such as luggage, shoes, and saddles. May use hand tools.
Stacker Description: Shoe and leather workers craft, repair, and restore leather goods ranging from footwear to luxury handbags and saddles. These artisans combine traditional hand tools with modern techniques to cut, stitch, and finish leather products. Many specialize in either new construction or restoration work, requiring deep knowledge of leather properties, dyeing techniques, and the intricate construction methods that ensure durability and aesthetic appeal.

SOC Definition: Operate or tend a variety of machines to join, decorate, reinforce, or finish shoes and shoe parts.
From Occupation Data: Operate or tend a variety of machines to join, decorate, reinforce, or finish shoes and shoe parts.
Stacker Description: Shoe machine operators run specialized equipment that assembles, decorates, and finishes footwear in manufacturing settings. They operate machines that attach soles, insert eyelets, apply adhesives, and perform other automated processes in shoe production. These workers must understand machine mechanics, maintain quality standards, and troubleshoot equipment issues while keeping pace with production schedules in fast-moving manufacturing environments.

SOC Definition: Sew, join, reinforce, or finish, usually with needle and thread, a variety of manufactured items. Includes weavers and stitchers.
From Occupation Data: Sew, join, reinforce, or finish, usually with needle and thread, a variety of manufactured items. Includes weavers and stitchers.
Stacker Description: Hand sewers perform intricate stitching work that machines cannot replicate, creating custom garments, decorative items, and specialty products. They use needles and thread to join fabrics, add embellishments, and finish delicate details on everything from haute couture clothing to home furnishings. This meticulous craft requires exceptional manual dexterity, pattern recognition skills, and the ability to work with various thread types and fabric textures.

SOC Definition: Design, make, alter, repair, or fit garments.
From Occupation Data: Design, make, alter, repair, or fit garments.
Stacker Description: Tailors, dressmakers, and custom sewers create bespoke clothing and alter existing garments to achieve perfect fits. These skilled artisans work with various fabrics and materials, using both traditional hand-sewing techniques and modern equipment. They consult with clients on design preferences, take precise measurements, and execute complex alterations. Many operate their own shops or work in specialty boutiques, combining creativity with technical precision.

SOC Title: Textile Bleaching and Dyeing Machine Operators and Tenders
title_lower: textile bleaching and dyeing machine operators and tenders
SOC Definition: Operate or tend machines to bleach, shrink, wash, dye, or finish textiles or synthetic or glass fibers.
From Occupation Data: Operate or tend machines to bleach, shrink, wash, dye, or finish textiles or synthetic or glass fibers.
Stacker Description: Textile bleaching and dyeing machine operators control specialized equipment that transforms raw fabrics into finished products. They monitor chemical processes that bleach, dye, shrink, or apply finishes to textiles, synthetic fibers, and glass materials. These workers ensure proper chemical mixtures, maintain optimal temperatures, and troubleshoot equipment issues. Their expertise is essential in producing the vibrant colors and textures found in clothing and home goods.

SOC Title: Textile Cutting Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders
title_lower: textile cutting machine setters, operators, and tenders
SOC Definition: Set up, operate, or tend machines that cut textiles.
From Occupation Data: Set up, operate, or tend machines that cut textiles.
Stacker Description: Textile cutting machine operators use precision equipment to cut fabrics according to specific patterns and specifications. They set up cutting machines, adjust blade settings, and ensure accurate cuts for garment production or industrial applications. These workers must understand fabric properties and cutting techniques to minimize waste while maintaining quality. Their role is crucial in the early stages of textile manufacturing and garment production.

SOC Title: Textile Knitting and Weaving Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders
title_lower: textile knitting and weaving machine setters, operators, and tenders
SOC Definition: Set up, operate, or tend machines that knit, loop, weave, or draw in textiles. Excludes “Sewing Machine Operators” (51-6031).
From Occupation Data: Set up, operate, or tend machines that knit, loop, weave, or draw in textiles.
Stacker Description: Textile knitting and weaving machine operators run sophisticated equipment that creates fabrics from yarn and thread. They set up looms and knitting machines, monitor production quality, and adjust settings to achieve desired fabric characteristics. These workers produce everything from basic cotton fabrics to complex synthetic materials used in clothing, upholstery, and industrial applications. Technical knowledge of machinery and textile properties is essential.

SOC Title: Textile Winding, Twisting, and Drawing Out Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders
title_lower: textile winding, twisting, and drawing out machine setters, operators, and tenders
SOC Definition: Set up, operate, or tend machines that wind or twist textiles; or draw out and combine sliver, such as wool, hemp, or synthetic fibers. Includes slubber machine and drawing frame operators.
From Occupation Data: Set up, operate, or tend machines that wind or twist textiles; or draw out and combine sliver, such as wool, hemp, or synthetic fibers. Includes slubber machine and drawing frame operators.
Stacker Description: Textile winding and twisting machine operators prepare fibers and yarns for fabric production by operating equipment that winds, twists, and combines materials like wool, hemp, and synthetic fibers. They set up drawing frames and slubber machines that transform raw fibers into uniform strands ready for weaving or knitting. This foundational step in textile manufacturing requires attention to detail and understanding of fiber properties.

SOC Title: Extruding and Forming Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Synthetic and Glass Fibers
title_lower: extruding and forming machine setters, operators, and tenders, synthetic and glass fibers
SOC Definition: Set up, operate, or tend machines that extrude and form continuous filaments from synthetic materials, such as liquid polymer, rayon, and fiberglass.
From Occupation Data: Set up, operate, or tend machines that extrude and form continuous filaments from synthetic materials, such as liquid polymer, rayon, and fiberglass.
Stacker Description: These specialized machine operators work with synthetic materials like liquid polymer, rayon, and fiberglass to create continuous filaments used in everything from clothing to industrial applications. They set up, monitor, and maintain complex extrusion equipment that transforms raw synthetic materials into usable fibers. The role requires technical expertise to ensure consistent quality and proper machine operation throughout the manufacturing process.

SOC Definition: Draw and construct sets of precision master fabric patterns or layouts. May also mark and cut fabrics and apparel.
From Occupation Data: Draw and construct sets of precision master fabric patterns or layouts. May also mark and cut fabrics and apparel.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: Fashion plates and keen crafters alike might be interested in this line of work. Fabric and apparel patternmakers cut and create the master patterns used to make all kinds of clothes. During the COVID-19 pandemic, many fashion brands pivoted to producing cloth face masks instead of their normal apparel—an endeavor that relies on the work of patternmakers.
Stacker Description: Fabric and apparel patternmakers create the precise master patterns that serve as blueprints for clothing and textile production. Using technical drawing skills and industry knowledge, they develop layouts that maximize fabric efficiency while ensuring proper fit and construction. These craftspeople bridge the gap between fashion design concepts and actual garment manufacturing, often marking and cutting fabrics based on their detailed patterns.

SOC Definition: Make, repair, or replace upholstery for household furniture or transportation vehicles.
From Occupation Data: Make, repair, or replace upholstery for household furniture or transportation vehicles.
Stacker Description: Upholsterers breathe new life into furniture by replacing, repairing, or installing fabric, leather, and padding on chairs, sofas, and vehicle seating. This skilled trade combines artistry with technical knowledge of materials, springs, and construction techniques. Whether restoring antique pieces or customizing modern furniture, upholsterers must understand both traditional craftsmanship and contemporary materials to deliver quality results.

SOC Title: Textile, Apparel, and Furnishings Workers, All Other
title_lower: textile, apparel, and furnishings workers, all other
SOC Definition: All textile, apparel, and furnishings workers not listed separately.
From Occupation Data: All textile, apparel, and furnishings workers not listed separately.
Stacker Description: This diverse category encompasses various specialized roles in textile and apparel manufacturing not covered by other classifications. Workers might focus on specific techniques like embroidery, fabric inspection, or specialized garment finishing. The textile industry's complexity requires numerous specialized skills, and these professionals fill crucial niches in the production process from raw materials to finished products.

SOC Definition: Cut, shape, and assemble wooden articles or set up and operate a variety of woodworking machines, such as power saws, jointers, and mortisers to surface, cut, or shape lumber or to fabricate parts for wood products. Excludes “Woodworking Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders” (51-7040).
From Occupation Data: Cut, shape, and assemble wooden articles or set up and operate a variety of woodworking machines, such as power saws, jointers, and mortisers to surface, cut, or shape lumber or to fabricate parts for wood products.
Stacker Description: Cabinetmakers and bench carpenters craft custom wooden furniture, cabinets, and architectural elements using both hand tools and sophisticated woodworking machinery. They transform raw lumber into finished pieces through precise cutting, shaping, and assembly techniques. This skilled trade requires expertise in wood properties, joinery methods, and finishing techniques to create durable, aesthetically pleasing products that meet exact specifications.

SOC Definition: Shape, finish, and refinish damaged, worn, or used furniture or new high-grade furniture to specified color or finish.
From Occupation Data: Shape, finish, and refinish damaged, worn, or used furniture or new high-grade furniture to specified color or finish.
Stacker Description: Furniture finishers restore and beautify wooden pieces, transforming worn or damaged furniture into polished works of art. They apply stains, paints, and protective coatings to achieve specific colors and finishes, working on everything from antique restorations to high-end custom pieces. This skilled craft requires knowledge of wood types, finishing techniques, and an eye for detail to bring furniture back to life.

SOC Definition: Construct full-size and scale wooden precision models of products. Includes wood jig builders and loft workers.
From Occupation Data: Construct full-size and scale wooden precision models of products. Includes wood jig builders and loft workers.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: As the name of the profession implies, wood model makers produce scale precision models of certain products. The vast majority of these professionals work in the furniture industry, but a small number are employed by architectural firms and the federal government.
Stacker Description: Model makers craft precise wooden prototypes and scale models that serve as blueprints for manufacturing. These skilled artisans translate technical drawings into three-dimensional wooden forms, creating everything from architectural models to product prototypes. Their work requires exceptional attention to detail and woodworking expertise, as these models guide the production of final products across various industries.

SOC Definition: Plan, lay out, and construct wooden unit or sectional patterns used in forming sand molds for castings.
From Occupation Data: Plan, lay out, and construct wooden unit or sectional patterns used in forming sand molds for castings.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: Wood patternmakers construct the models used to form sand molds for casting, primarily in the furniture manufacturing industry. Nearly all the jobs in this profession are located in Michigan, where Grand Rapids was once known as "Furniture City" and had a reputation as the global leader in fine wooden furniture.
Stacker Description: Patternmakers create the wooden templates essential for metal casting processes. They design and construct precise wooden patterns that form the molds used to shape molten metal into specific parts and components. This specialized craft combines traditional woodworking skills with engineering knowledge, as these patterns must account for metal shrinkage and casting requirements to produce accurate final products.

SOC Title: Sawing Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Wood
title_lower: sawing machine setters, operators, and tenders, wood
SOC Definition: Set up, operate, or tend wood sawing machines. May operate computer numerically controlled (CNC) equipment. Includes lead sawyers. Workers who primarily program or operate CNC equipment are classified in “Computer Numerically Controlled Tool Operators and Programmers” (51-9160).
From Occupation Data: Set up, operate, or tend wood sawing machines. May operate computer numerically controlled (CNC) equipment. Includes lead sawyers.
Stacker Description: Sawing machine operators transform raw lumber into precisely cut pieces for manufacturing and construction. They set up and operate various cutting equipment, including computer-controlled machines that can execute complex cuts with exceptional accuracy. These skilled workers must understand wood grain patterns, safety protocols, and machine programming to efficiently produce the dimensional lumber needed across industries.

SOC Title: Woodworking Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Except Sawing
title_lower: woodworking machine setters, operators, and tenders, except sawing
SOC Definition: Set up, operate, or tend woodworking machines, such as drill presses, lathes, shapers, routers, sanders, planers, and wood nailing machines. May operate computer numerically controlled (CNC) equipment. Workers who primarily program or operate CNC equipment are classified in “Computer Numerically Controlled Tool Operators and Programmers” (51-9160).
From Occupation Data: Set up, operate, or tend woodworking machines, such as drill presses, lathes, shapers, routers, sanders, planers, and wood nailing machines. May operate computer numerically controlled (CNC) equipment.
Stacker Description: Woodworking machine operators shape and finish wood products using specialized equipment like drill presses, sanders, and routers. They program and operate both traditional and computer-controlled machinery to create furniture components, architectural elements, and custom wood products. This role requires technical skills in machine operation and programming, plus knowledge of wood properties and finishing techniques.

SOC Definition: All woodworkers not listed separately.
From Occupation Data: All woodworkers not listed separately.
Stacker Description: Woodworkers in this category create custom furniture, cabinetry, and specialty wood products that don't fit into other defined woodworking roles. They might craft musical instruments, restore antique pieces, or build architectural millwork. These artisans combine traditional hand tools with modern machinery, requiring both technical precision and creative vision to transform raw lumber into functional or decorative items.

SOC Definition: Operate or control nuclear reactors. Move control rods, start and stop equipment, monitor and adjust controls, and record data in logs. Implement emergency procedures when needed. May respond to abnormalities, determine cause, and recommend corrective action.
From Occupation Data: Operate or control nuclear reactors. Move control rods, start and stop equipment, monitor and adjust controls, and record data in logs. Implement emergency procedures when needed. May respond to abnormalities, determine cause, and recommend corrective action.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: Talk about a high-pressure job. Nuclear power reactor operators are responsible for controlling the equipment and controls at nuclear power plants, as well as responding to any abnormalities or emergencies when needed. New York employs the highest numbers of nuclear power reactor operators in the country, and gets more than a third of its electricity from nuclear power.
Stacker Description: Nuclear power reactor operators control the systems that generate electricity from nuclear reactions. They monitor gauges and computer displays, adjust control rods to regulate reactor output, and maintain detailed logs of operations. When emergencies arise, these highly trained professionals implement safety protocols to protect both the facility and surrounding communities. Extensive training and federal licensing are required for this critical role.

SOC Definition: Coordinate, regulate, or distribute electricity or steam.
From Occupation Data: Coordinate, regulate, or distribute electricity or steam.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: Power distributors and dispatchers work for power companies or local governments to coordinate, distribute, or regulate electricity or steam. Although the country's dependence on electricity continues to grow, jobs in this field are expected to decline as technological advances make the nation more energy-efficient.
Stacker Description: Power distributors and dispatchers ensure electricity flows reliably from power plants to homes and businesses. They monitor the electrical grid in real-time, rerouting power during outages or peak demand periods. These professionals coordinate with multiple utilities and make split-second decisions to prevent blackouts. Their work requires understanding complex electrical systems and the ability to respond quickly to changing conditions.

SOC Definition: Control, operate, or maintain machinery to generate electric power. Includes auxiliary equipment operators. Excludes “Nuclear Power Reactor Operators” (51-8011).
From Occupation Data: Control, operate, or maintain machinery to generate electric power. Includes auxiliary equipment operators.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: Power plant operators generate electric power by using specialized machines, and typically work for either electric companies or local governments. States with large populations—and heavy demand for electricity—like California and New York boast the highest number of jobs for this occupation.
Stacker Description: Power plant operators run the massive machinery that generates electricity for entire regions. They monitor boilers, turbines, generators, and other equipment while adjusting controls to maintain optimal power output. These operators perform routine maintenance, troubleshoot mechanical problems, and ensure compliance with environmental regulations. Their expertise keeps the lights on for millions of people daily.

SOC Definition: Operate or maintain stationary engines, boilers, or other mechanical equipment to provide utilities for buildings or industrial processes. Operate equipment such as steam engines, generators, motors, turbines, and steam boilers.
From Occupation Data: Operate or maintain stationary engines, boilers, or other mechanical equipment to provide utilities for buildings or industrial processes. Operate equipment such as steam engines, generators, motors, turbines, and steam boilers.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: Regardless of the industry, stationary engineers and boiler operators work on mechanical equipment such as boilers and stationary engines. Many work in manufacturing, hospitals, and government facilities, and often work night and weekend shifts.
Stacker Description: Stationary engineers and boiler operators maintain the mechanical systems that provide heat, power, and air conditioning to large buildings and industrial facilities. They monitor pressure gauges, adjust fuel mixtures, and perform preventive maintenance on boilers, engines, and turbines. These skilled technicians ensure hospitals, schools, and factories have reliable utilities while maintaining safety standards and energy efficiency.

SOC Title: Water and Wastewater Treatment Plant and System Operators
title_lower: water and wastewater treatment plant and system operators
SOC Definition: Operate or control an entire process or system of machines, often through the use of control boards, to transfer or treat water or wastewater.
From Occupation Data: Operate or control an entire process or system of machines, often through the use of control boards, to transfer or treat water or wastewater.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: Water and wastewater treatment plant and system operators control an entire system of machines to treat local communities' water and wastewater. These professionals primarily work for local governments and waste treatment companies, but a small percentage works for other industries, like animal processing, architecture and engineering.
Stacker Description: Water and wastewater treatment plant operators ensure communities have access to clean drinking water and properly treated sewage. Using sophisticated control systems and monitoring equipment, they oversee complex filtration, chemical treatment, and purification processes. These operators must understand chemistry, biology, and environmental regulations while maintaining the critical infrastructure that protects public health and the environment.

SOC Definition: Control or operate entire chemical processes or system of machines.
From Occupation Data: Control or operate entire chemical processes or system of machines.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: The vast majority of chemical plant and system operators work in chemical manufacturing, although a smaller number work in petroleum products and pharmaceutical manufacturing. The highest concentration of these jobs can be found in Louisiana.
Stacker Description: Chemical plant operators control sophisticated manufacturing processes that produce everything from plastics to pharmaceuticals. Working with dangerous materials and high-pressure systems, they monitor computer-controlled equipment, adjust chemical reactions, and ensure safety protocols are followed. These operators require extensive training in chemistry, safety procedures, and emergency response to manage complex industrial operations.

SOC Definition: Distribute or process gas for utility companies and others by controlling compressors to maintain specified pressures on main pipelines.
From Occupation Data: Distribute or process gas for utility companies and others by controlling compressors to maintain specified pressures on main pipelines.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: Gas plant operators distribute natural gas for utility companies through a system of pressurized pipelines. Natural gas consumption in the U.S. was lower across most sectors in 2020, but global demand, including the United States, is expected to stay stable or grow through 2025.
Stacker Description: Gas plant operators maintain the flow of natural gas from processing facilities to homes and businesses across the country. They monitor pipeline pressures, operate compression equipment, and ensure safe distribution through vast networks of underground pipes. These operators work around the clock to maintain steady gas supplies while preventing dangerous leaks or pressure failures.

SOC Title: Petroleum Pump System Operators, Refinery Operators, and Gaugers
title_lower: petroleum pump system operators, refinery operators, and gaugers
SOC Definition: Operate or control petroleum refining or processing units. May specialize in controlling manifold and pumping systems, gauging or testing oil in storage tanks, or regulating the flow of oil into pipelines.
From Occupation Data: Operate or control petroleum refining or processing units. May specialize in controlling manifold and pumping systems, gauging or testing oil in storage tanks, or regulating the flow of oil into pipelines.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: The overwhelming majority of petroleum pump system operators, refinery operators, and gaugers work for petroleum and coal products manufacturing companies, though a smaller number work in the oil and natural gas industries. Texas employs the bulk of these workers, thanks to its position as the leading producer of crude oil in the country.
Stacker Description: Petroleum refinery operators transform crude oil into gasoline, diesel, and other essential products through complex refining processes. They control distillation towers, catalytic crackers, and pumping systems while monitoring quality and safety standards. These operators must understand chemistry, equipment mechanics, and environmental regulations to safely manage the volatile materials and high-temperature processes involved in oil refining.

SOC Title: Plant and System Operators, All Other
title_lower: plant and system operators, all other
SOC Definition: All plant and system operators not listed separately.
From Occupation Data: All plant and system operators not listed separately.
Stacker Description: Plant and system operators in specialized industries manage unique manufacturing and processing equipment not covered by other categories. Whether overseeing food processing, pharmaceutical production, or industrial manufacturing, they ensure smooth operations through careful monitoring and control of automated systems. These operators adapt their skills to industry-specific equipment and safety requirements.

SOC Definition: Operate or tend equipment to control chemical changes or reactions in the processing of industrial or consumer products. Equipment used includes devulcanizers, steam-jacketed kettles, and reactor vessels. Excludes “Chemical Plant and System Operators” (51-8091).
From Occupation Data: Operate or tend equipment to control chemical changes or reactions in the processing of industrial or consumer products. Equipment used includes devulcanizers, steam-jacketed kettles, and reactor vessels.
Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: In the manufacturing of chemicals, pharmaceuticals, aluminum, and petroleum products, chemical equipment operators and tenders use complex equipment to control chemical changes and reactions. These skilled workers operate machinery such as devulcanizers, steam-jacketed kettles, and reactor vessels, and may need specialized on-the-job training.
Stacker Description: Chemical equipment operators and tenders control specialized machinery that transforms raw materials into finished products through chemical reactions. They monitor reactor vessels, steam-jacketed kettles, and other industrial equipment to ensure proper temperatures, pressures, and timing during manufacturing processes. These workers play a critical role in producing everything from pharmaceuticals to plastics, requiring strong attention to detail and understanding of chemical safety protocols.

SOC Title: Separating, Filtering, Clarifying, Precipitating, and Still Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders
title_lower: separating, filtering, clarifying, precipitating, and still machine setters, operators, and tenders
SOC Definition: Set up, operate, or tend continuous flow or vat-type equipment; filter presses; shaker screens; centrifuges; condenser tubes; precipitating, fermenting, or evaporating tanks; scrubbing towers; or batch stills. These machines extract, sort, or separate liquids, gases, or solids from other materials to recover a refined product. Includes dairy processing equipment operators. Excludes “Chemical Equipment Operators and Tenders” (51-9011).
From Occupation Data: Set up, operate, or tend continuous flow or vat-type equipment; filter presses; shaker screens; centrifuges; condenser tubes; precipitating, fermenting, or evaporating tanks; scrubbing towers; or batch stills. These machines extract, sort, or separate liquids, gases, or solids from other materials to recover a refined product. Includes dairy processing equipment operators.
Stacker Description: These specialized machine operators run equipment that separates and purifies materials by extracting liquids, gases, or solids from mixtures. They operate centrifuges, filter presses, distillation equipment, and fermentation tanks to refine products ranging from dairy items to industrial chemicals. The work requires technical skill in operating complex machinery and understanding how different separation processes recover valuable materials from raw substances.

SOC Title: Crushing, Grinding, and Polishing Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders
title_lower: crushing, grinding, and polishing machine setters, operators, and tenders
SOC Definition: Set up, operate, or tend machines to crush, grind, or polish materials, such as coal, glass, grain, stone, food, or rubber.
From Occupation Data: Set up, operate, or tend machines to crush, grind, or polish materials, such as coal, glass, grain, stone, food, or rubber.
Stacker Description: Crushing, grinding, and polishing machine operators transform raw materials into usable products by breaking them down or smoothing their surfaces. They operate heavy machinery to process everything from coal and stone to food products and rubber materials. These workers must understand proper machine settings, safety procedures, and quality standards while maintaining equipment that shapes materials for construction, manufacturing, and consumer use.

SOC Definition: Perform any or all of the following functions in the manufacture of electronic semiconductors: load semiconductor material into furnace; saw formed ingots into segments; load individual segment into crystal growing chamber and monitor controls; locate crystal axis in ingot using x-ray equipment and saw ingots into wafers; and clean, polish, and load wafers into series of special purpose furnaces, chemical baths, and equipment used to form circuitry and change conductive properties.

SOC Definition: Supervise and coordinate the activities of ground crew in the loading, unloading, securing, and staging of aircraft cargo or baggage. Highest-paying jobs for high school grad: Aircraft cargo handling supervisors are in charge of the workers moving suitcases, baggage, and all other cargo from planes to baggage claim. Some supervisors serve as loadmasters, accompanying flights to monitor cargo and assist passengers with safety procedures during emergencies.
